WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team. AMD together we advance_ The Role We are looking for a Member of Technical Staff (MTS) to join us AI engine verification San Jose Team. In this role, you will be working on the cutting-edge AI Engine, the technology offering the world’s most scalable solutions from intelligent sensor to edge compute, evolves with AI innovations in the industry. You will be working with architects and designers to define the verification strategy for the design, develop and review test plans, execute the test plans using industry standard tools like System Verilog and UVM. You will contribute to the overall success of the product and business by ensuring high quality through detail-oriented industry standard verification leading to tape out. The Person Member of Technical Staff will be able to collaborate with across functional team, he/she will be a dynamic, quality-conscious, attention oriented individual with significant experience in successfully verifying and taping out complex designs with high quality. Key Responsibilities Will be working as a member of a cross geographic pre_silicon verification team to verify a next generation AI engine. Will be working with design, architecture team to verify micro-architecture and design across multiple platforms Responsible for a comprehensive verification plan and drive the implementation of verification test cases from applications and other sources Responsible for regression, verification infrastructure development Mentoring junior engineers Preferred Experience Experience in specifying and developing the verification infrastructure for verifying CPU/DSP/Vector-datapath designs 8+ years of experience in the verification with experience of CPU/Video/DSP/vector processors, SIMD is a plus. Strong foundation in SoC architecture and verification of multi-core processors including SIMD, Vector processors, floating point, etc. is a plus Expertise in Verilog/System Verilog, C/C++/SystemC, UVM, Scripting languages like Perl/Python, etc. Strong experience in HDL, verification, and general computational logic design/verification concepts Strong analytical problem solving, and attention to detail Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent interpersonal skills, self-motivated Academic Credentials Requires BS or MS or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science or related equivalent Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team. AMD together we advance_ The Role The “AI Engine” Architecture group is looking for an engineer who can make significant contributions to the specification of next-generation AI/ML processor. The role includes understanding the requirements coming from key use-cases and proposing/adapting architecture specification to meet these requirements. Especially in areas of data movement and reshaping, synchronization, control, and integration into SoC devices. The role requires both technical and creative skills to contribute to this emerging and innovative computer architecture. The Person This is an engineer or computer scientist who is passionate about computer architecture and programming. Someone who enjoys solving problems, can understand diverse requirements, propose practical and novel solutions and is able to share these solutions across technical teams. A successful candidate must be willing to work as part of a team with a shared goal and can work on several tasks in parallel to enable productization of our roadmap. Experience with emerging machine learning applications or digital signal processing is a bonus, but not essential. Key Responsibilities Responsible for specifying next generation architecture definition Especially in areas of data movement and reshaping, synchronization, control and reconfiguration, interfacing with SoC, security and reliability, debug and trace Performance modelling and specifying performance requirements Specification of solutions (spoken, written & figures) Understanding key use-cases, extracting requirements, and adapting architecture specification to maximize performance, power, area and programmability Role includes a wide range of disciplines including machine learning for data center (HPC) and embedded computing (e.g., automotive ADAS) applications; emerging memory technologies; on-chip interconnects; modern heterogeneous multicore architectures Bare-metal prototyping of design patterns from key use-cases to validate architecture Working closely with Design, Verification, Software and Application teams Preferred Experience Software engineering experience relevant to modern architecture modeling Strong background in modern microarchitectures High level understanding of microarchitecture at the system and SoC levels Strong C/C++ programming experience and scripting skills Good understanding of on-chip interconnect architectures and memory hierarchy in heterogeneous architectures Programming modern parallel architectures Flexibility, interest in technology and eagerness to learn Academic Credentials BS minimum, MS or PhD in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering or related equivalent and experience in the field     LOCATION: San Jose, CA, Dublin Ireland or Cambridge UK   Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. AMD together we advance_ The Role The AMD (AECG) Associate Sales Support Specialist will play a fundamental role in revenue growth objectives by working independently with our sales, business, and operations teams. Key Responsibilties Design Registration Management Quoting Revenue Management and Allocation Pipeline Management Analytical Reporting Tier One support for Field Sales Data administration and processing Liaison between Business Operations and Customer Operations to coordinate pricing and distribution Prefered Experience Entry Level, or 1-5 years in Sales Operations, or Business Operations Microsoft Office experience required (Outlook, Powerpoint, Excel, Word) Salesforce.com experience preferred Electronics manufacturing and supply chain experience preferred but not required Must be interested in technology Goal Oriented, Self-Motivated and Disciplined Work Ethic Ability to Communicate Effectively (Written & Verbal) With Customers, Partners, and Internal personnel Excellent Organizational Skills to Effectively Multi-Task / Handle the Various Tasks of the Role Strong understanding of business system and analytical reporting tool usage, understanding of use models, data structure and general business work flow Process and analyze data in Excel using advanced features such as Vlookup, Pivot tables to build charts and summarize data for business consumption Effectively communicate a problem statement with a proposed solution Ability to document a sales process, end to end Identify redundancies and process inhibitors; proposes improvements to own activities Partner with Sales to participate in the customer discovery, research process Establishes and accesses regular flows of information on markets, customers, or applications that relate to one's job Ability to assemble and present a PowerPoint presentation to peers Customer Service Skills: Inside sales reps will need to be able speak in a friendly way to customers and potential customers, listening to their needs and helping communicate options for them. Communication Skills: Inside sales reps speak to customers about AMD (AECG) product's and answer any questions they might have. Persistence: Not every customer is going to be a sale. Being able to bounce back is key. Sales representatives might work to follow up on sales leads Inside sales representatives work internal AMD (AECG) field sales customers to find what they need, create solutions and ensure a smooth sales process Maintaining a database of current and potential customers and opportunities Researching and qualifying new leads Academic Credentials Bachelor’s Degree preferred, or other Technical Degree Compensation Range & Benefits Expected to range from $37,100 to $68,900, commensurate with experience and specific skill sets. WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team. AMD together we advance_ The Role The Automotive Business Segment Team within the Core Vertical Markets Group is responsible for the development and execution of AMD’s Adaptable Technology market leadership strategy for the global automotive industry. This strategy includes silicon roadmap, application-specific solutions (including IP, software, and development/demonstration platforms), ecosystem partners, and customer engagement. The group is charged with maintaining and expanding the AMD Automotive adaptive silicon product line, including both inbound product definition and outbound marketing. It is ultimately responsible for managing long-term strategic OEM and Tier One customer relationships and continuing revenue growth and profitability for the company. The Automotive business segment team is made up primarily of automotive OEM, Tier One, and semiconductor industry veterans. The Person The Automotive System Architect – North America will report to and align with the Automotive Solutions & Architectures Director and will also have direct access and interaction with the Automotive Business Segment Senior Director. The Automotive System Architect role focuses on the strategic application of AMD’s world class CPU, GPU, AI, and Programmable Logic technology in the automotive market, specifically in the areas of Advanced Driver Assistance (ADAS)/ Automated Driving, Infotainment, and Driver Information. Responsibilities include development of targeted solutions, creating/maintaining vehicle-based demonstration platforms, customer/project specific architectural analysis/proposals, and engagement with key AMD automotive ecosystem partners. The role includes working closely with AMD sales, automotive marketing, and factory personnel to identify and develop compelling value propositions for our customers that support continued long-term growth of the Xilinx automotive business, as well as development of key customer relationships where trust drives transparency and opportunity. Key Responisibilites In this role you will: Provide broad practical automotive technical expertise, in terms of automotive ECU design, HW/SW architectures, and application specific methodologies, to sales teams calling on automotive customers with the objective of driving sales growth. Identify and characterize, through technical analysis, specific AMD/Xilinx Programmable Logic and adaptive SoC value propositions that differentiate AMD/Xilinx products from ASSP products in targeted automotive applications. Work with sales and marketing to communicate identified value propositions. Develop and maintain relationships with strategic internal/external IP partners applicable to the automotive segment with the objective of guiding partner activity and priorities based on differentiating programmable logic solutions from ASSP approaches and maximizing sales growth. Define and develop (leveraging partners and internal resources) targeted solutions (IP, Software, Reference Designs, Targeted Development Platforms, Vehicle-based Testbeds) aligned with relevant market/customer challenges, that enhance the overall value proposition of AMD products and increase product penetration over ASSP, DSP, and SOC alternatives. Monitor and/or manage progress at partners where Automotive Solutions funding is used to subsidize development toward automotive customers goals/needs. Develop and maintain key technical senior management/executive relationships with strategic automotive customers and OEMs to complement existing or developing sales relationships. Use relationships to determine customer solutions needs and influence customer architectures. Work with AMD product planning team to develop, communicate, and justify automotive requirements relevant to future products. Collaborate with AMD FAEs and Specialists (e.g., Processor, DSP, Quality, Functional Safety, etc.) to produce specific application and product design solutions for customers. Preferred Experiece Minimum of 10 years of automotive supplier/OEM and/or automotive semiconductor industry experience Delivery of an Automotive Product to an OEM or Tier1 through entire life cycle (Design/Development to Warranty Returns) highly desired Technical expertise in the application of advanced semiconductors with a working knowledge of embedded automotive processors/processing systems Knowledge of automotive MPU and MCU suppliers and high-level understanding of their primary value propositions Knowledge of automotive analog suppliers for ethernet, camera sensors, etc. Semiconductor device definition and automotive application use case development Knowledge of automotive electronics market, trends, and applications and direct experience with Infotainment and/or Driver Assistance/Automated Driving applications (HW & SW) First-hand experience in designing, developing, and or implementing IVI or ADAS/AD systems Application-level development with on-vehicle implementation is highly desired High level understanding of key standards and best practices around Safety and Security Specific to ADAS/AD, familiarity of SAE AD levels and associated NCAP and NHTSA requirements Experience with automotive ECU architecture and/or development including: Defining overall ECU architectures and mapping/partitioning automotive ECU functionality to electronic components Knowledge of automotive interfaces; CAN-FD, Automotive Ethernet, SerDes, MIPI, etc. Familiarity with application of FPGA technology is a plus Expertise in Software Development and Automotive Operating Systems Experience in writing/testing Automotive Embedded Software code Experience with Linux and/or Android and an Automotive RTOS (e.g., QNX and Greenhill) and automotive hypervisors AUTOSAR knowledge is a strong plus Strong communication skills (verbal, written, presentation, and negotiation) Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a highly cross-functional and geographically diverse organization Must be a strong team player and very self-motivated, self-starting, individual Must be fluent in the English language Job locations in Southeast Michigan – will consider other location for the right candidate Must be willing to travel domestically with occasional overseas travel Academic Credentials BS Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent degree (minimum). LOCATION: Michigan-Remote Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD together we advance_ Business Product Planner The Role This role is a key position within the AMD Server Operations team. The individual will co-own one of AMD’s server product lines driving supply-demand reconciliation, inventory positioning, and new product introduction support. The candidate will act as a critical linkage between the Business, Sales, Engineering, Finance, and Supply Chain organizations. Key Responsibilities Provide supply-demand reconciliation Create product supply request plan Billing/Backlog analysis Recommend demand shaping opportunities to achieve business goals Inventory analysis Weekly inventory update Aged inventory review Sample plan management for New Product Introduction Consolidation of sample requests from key stakeholders Planning responsibility for key product lines Review all planning inputs with functional owners to drive accountability and data accuracy (Yields, BOM, Capacity, etc.) Preferred Experience Prior experience in Operations role in semiconductor field Strong leadership, communication, and analytical skills Experience presenting to executive management a plus Reporting and modeling software expertise (Excel, Power BI, Tableau, power point) Highly analytical, with a good sense of finance and accounting concepts Comfortable in navigating a fast-paced constantly changing environment, while successfully managing towards Key Performance Indicators Academic Credentials Masters’ degree or Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering discipline, or business operations Location: Austin, TX Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD together we advance_ The Role AMD’s Cores Organization delivers industry leading CPU’s and caches that are the foundation of AMD’s server, client, and gaming business. We are looking for an experienced cache verification engineer to join this innovative team as a technical expert. The candidate will be a key contributor and potential leader for AMD’s next generation cores and caches. The candidate will join the team based in Fort Collins, CO. The Person The candidate should have strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with excellent attention to details. We work on programs with long timelines, so self-motivation and a commitment to meeting deadlines is required. We are pushing the envelope on chip performance, so the status quo must be challenged on every program. This requires creativity and innovation, but also excellent verbal and written communication skills. We work in small teams, but we are part of a large cross-site Core’s organization, so teamwork is also vital our success. Key Responsibilities Perform Functional verification of high-speed Microprocessor designs, including development of infrastructure, directed and random test suites at behavioral RTL and gate design levels across SoC, Core and block hierarchies. Develop environments, infrastructure, and test plans to accommodate both full chip and stand-alone block-level verification and debug capabilities using simulation tools, debug tools and programming skills, based on in-depth understanding of the architecture and HDL/logical design of the microprocessor. Based on thorough understanding of the design architecture, develop, run and debug x86 assembly based directed tests and random exercisers to validate functionality and testability operation of the microprocessor design leveraging C/C++/Perl/assembly programming, logic design and simulation skill set. Drive project deliverables/dependencies with cross-discipline/site RTL, DFT and Implementation design teams along with product manufacturing teams. Solve design and tool problems requiring ground-breaking approaches and champion innovation across the organization. Create technical presentations for peers and management. Guide junior engineers. Preferred Experience Prior experience with verification techniques of microprocessors/ASIC designs. Proven programming proficiency in x86 assembly, C/C++, Perl, and Ruby languages along with strong logic simulation competence. Demonstrated expertise with Verilog HDL and System Verilog. Demonstrated solid understanding of modern computer architecture. DFT feature knowledge with JTAG -1149.x, Memory, Logic and I/O Built-In-Self-Test(BIST) and Scan design(LSSD/MuxD) structures and protocol would be a plus. Academic Credentials BS/MS in EE, CS, CSE (or similar), plus 3+ years verification experience LOCATION: Fort Collins, Colorado, USA Compensation Range & Benefits Expected to range from $109,760 to $156,800, commensurate with experience and specific skill sets. AMD together we advance_ SPRING 2023 POWER SYSTEMS DESIGN CO-OP/INTERN Location: Austin Texas ONSITE: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. Spring: Start Date January 9 or January 16, 2023 – May 12, 2023 What You’ll Be Doing The successful candidate would be responsible for supporting the architecture, design, analysis, and verification of power systems intended for powering high performance CPUs/GPUs/APUs. The engineer will work with cross-functional teams to design and implement a full power delivery network, model and validate PDN impedance and droop targets, and verify power supply integrity using lab and in-situ silicon measurements. In addition, the candidate is expected to work with the Board Validation team to develop procedures to perform system-level validation for characterizing design margins on the power domains. Key Qualifications Technical understanding of power supply architectures and PDN in server, OAM, and PCIe environments Understanding and experience with multi-phase buck/buck-boost regulators, digital PWM controllers, bus converters, LDOs, PMICs, charge pumps, ADCs & DACs, etc Working knowledge of 2D/2.5D EM simulation tools such as Sigrity’s PowerDC, PowerSI, SiWave or equivalent Knowledge of high frequency magnetics design for power electronics Familiarity with PCB design tools such as OrCAD or Allegro Proficiency with lab equipment such as oscilloscope, eload, function generator, etc. Experience with analog circuit modeling and simulation tools (e.g. Simplis, PSpice, HSpice etc.) Knowledge of AMD’s SVIx power management interface What Would Set You Apart Must be a team player with good written and verbal communication skills Ability to work with multiple cross functional teams Who We’re Looking For 2+ years of relevant EE and Power design classes 1+ years of relevant industry experience Junior and Senior (year 3 and 4) or MS. Benefits Healthcare coverage, dental and vision Paid holidays Relocation stipend Education assistance for required Co-op/Intern course Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD together we advance_ The Role We are looking for an outstanding candidate to provide technical expertise for execution on the functional verification strategy for our next generation microprocessor designs. You will maintain and improve existing functional verification methodology, improve existing infrastructure, and work on related projects and/or assignments as needed to meet team goals. Additionally, you will perform project definition, training and documentation. Finally, you will work with architects and TG/PG RTL/Designers and develop an effective working relationship with parties involved. If this sounds like you, we welcome you to apply! The Person The ideal candidate will have good communication skills and the ability to work with a team with varied strengths. Key Responsibilities Perform functional feature verification of high speed Microprocessor designs, including development of infrastructure, directed and random test suites at behavioral RTL level across SoC, Core and block hierarchies. Develop environments, infrastructure and test plans to accommodate both full chip and stand alone block level verification and debug capabilities using simulation tools, debug tools and programming skills, based on in-depth understanding of the architecture and HDL/logical design of the microprocessor. Develop an automated regression infrastructure setup for functional verification of high speed microprocessor designs. Based on thorough understanding of the design architecture, develop, run and debug x86 assembly based directed tests and random exercisers to validate functionality and testability operation of the microprocessor design C/C++/Perl/assembly programming, logic design and simulation skills. Resolve all simulation discrepancies and assertion responses for both behavioral and gate level logic models. Measure and analyze coverage results and take vital actions to fill in coverage holes. Preferred Experience Understanding or technical expertise in functional verification of microprocessor designs. Experience with Verilog/SystemVerilog HDL, programming in Perl, C/C++ Logic simulation experience is a big plus Direct experience with Verilog simulators is a plus. Strong understanding of computer architecture and assembly programming. Academic Credentials MS or PhD with some industry co-op experience desired (all degrees are related to CS or EE). Location: Poughkeepsie, NY, US Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. Resolve all simulation discrepancies and assertion responses for both behavioral and gate level logic models. Measure and analyze coverage results and take necessary actions to fill in coverage holes. Preferred Experience CPU level design verification experience with a background in Computer Architecture and excellent coding skills. Other skills include: Processor pipeline and memory hierarchy. Hands-on work in C++ programming for either hardware modeling or testbench development or projects of similar scope and complexity. Experience with industry standard verification testbench and IP methodology such as UVM or similar. Assembly language programming and Instruction Set Architecture of a current microprocessor. Hardware Verification methodology and techniques such as simulation, debug, coverage, formal, etc. Experience working in a Unix/Linux environment. Scripting languages (e.g. Perl or Python or Ruby). Key Responsibilities Research, design, develop, and/or test electronic components and systems for semiconductor and related device manufacturing, employing knowledge of electronic theory. Independently develop quality, timely and cost effective solutions. Demonstrate technical leadership across project and departmental boundaries. Establish and maintain AMD’s technological leadership position in an area. Deal with problems requiring cutting edge approaches and and champion innovation across the organization. Represents AMD to the outside technical community, partners and vendors. CPU Performance Architect The Role This Senior Design Engineer in the Core Performance team will contribute using their experience with CPU microarchitecture development, performance modeling, and analysis. Over the medium and longer-term they will have opportunities to expand their technical contributions more deeply into CPU microarchitecture performance simulator development, workload and performance analysis, and model correlation. If this sounds like a good match for you, come join our team! The Person The ideal candidate for the Cores team will be able to demonstrate success in a comparable technical role on a product team innovating and redefining high-performance computing. He or she will be comfortable working in a cross-team environment and show creativity and self-motivation in their academic and post-academic career. Key Responsibilities Collaborate with a team of hardware and software engineers to optimize the performance of CPU microarchitecture Collaborate with other Architects on idea generation for next generation high performance CPU Cores Expand your experience with cycle-accurate core microarchitecture performance simulator development, workload and trace analysis, microarchitecture development, and RTL vs performance model correlation. Preferred Experience C++ programming and scripting language skills Computer architecture background through coursework and/or work experience Cycle-accurate microarchitecture performance simulator development Pre-silicon performance analysis Computing software, including operating systems, compilers, and applications. Demonstrate thought leadership and perseverance with published papers or filed patents that contribute to the industry Academic Credentials Bachelors, Masters, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering. Masters or PhD is preferred/desirable. Relevant industry experience is preferred/desirable. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team. AMD together we advance_ CPU Post Silicon Verification/Validation Engineer The Role AMD’s high-profile CPU Cores Silicon Verification team is seeking engineers who will help us bring Ryzen and Epyc CPUs to the market. If you are passionate about CPU architecture and thrive in a Core Silicon Lab environment, this highly visible role is for you! You will work with some of the top CPU micro-architects and designers in the industry. As a Core silicon verification engineer you will create workloads to stress the CPU, focus on bringup of next generation Core architectures, debug issues in the lab and create innovative solutions to root cause bugs before products can be launched. As a key member of the team that was instrumental in the launch of industry leading Zen Cores, you will collaborate across design, platform engineering and product teams, your work will get high quality CPUs in the hands of millions of customers worldwide. The Person The ideal candidate for this role loves technical challenges and is a natural problem solver. Is detail-oriented, seeks continuous improvement in processes and methodologies, and maniacal about quality. Possesses excellent communication, comprehension, and thrives in ambiguity. Enjoys working in a fast-paced environment while creating and deploying state of the art tools. Key Responsibilities Write and refine Silicon Verification testplans collaborating with RTL, DV engineers Develop and deploy directed/random tests on silicon to verify the x86 CPU design for bring-up and stress tests Identify and root cause core silicon bugs. Work with architects, RTL design, pre-silicon verification engineers to resolve emulation and silicon failures Contribute towards design of hardware irritators to validate features on silicon Support efforts to reproduce silicon failures on pre-silicon and FPGA/Emulation platforms Collaborate towards lab regression testing, infrastructure development and automation Preferred Experience Strong understanding of CPU (X86, ARM, PowerPC etc) architecture and micro-architecture Micro-architectural debug skills in emulation and post silicon domains. SOC level hardware and/or Embedded Systems verification Hardware and software Virtualization Architectural and Microarchitectural Security paradigms C / C++ and Assembly Language Programming CPU pre-silicon/emulation/performance modeling Silicon validation/FPGA/Emulator experience Academic Credentials BS/MS/PhD in Electrical/Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering is required Location: Austin, Texas Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD together we advance_ CPU CORE RTL DESIGN ENGINEER The Role As a CPU Core Architecture/RTL Engineer, you will have a unique opportunity to craft a functional unit in AMD’s next-generation core. You will work in the center of an experienced, skilled, and motivated engineering team with a track record of success. As a member of the Core Architecture/RTL team, you will work on the leading edge of processor technology and collaborate with the Performance Modeling, Design Verification, Physical Design, and Post-Silicon Teams to make AMD’s ambitious future CPU roadmap a reality. The Person You approach challenges relentlessly with both critical thinking and creativity. You work as part of a team with strong communication and collaboration skills. You have a solid understanding of modern CPU architecture and have ideas and/or drive to make it even better. Does this describe you? If so, then join us! Key Responsibilities Execute on RTL design and coding for various sections of the processor core pipeline and related logic. Collaborate with a team of hardware and software engineers to define the high-level architecture. Participate in the definition of microarchitecture of next-generation high-performance processor cores. Contribute to design verification, performance verification, synthesis, power reduction, timing convergence, and floorplan efforts. Contribute to silicon debug and product support as needed. Preferred Experience Verilog RTL development with industry tools in a CPU, SOC or ASIC environment Demonstrates expertise in the following: Processor architecture Logic design RTL coding experience for a high-speed processor Power-saving techniques Exposure to physical design and verification methods Awareness of synthesis, place and route, and timing closure concepts Development experience from clean-sheet design to product tapeout to post-silicon debug. Proven experience with microarchitecture development, as demonstrated by patents, publications, product features Strong problem-solving and debugging skills in both pre- and post-silicon environments. Additional Experience Desired Background in other aspects of ASIC implementation, especially with synthesis flow and static timing analysis Knowledge of microprocessor Design-for-Test (DFT) and Design-for-Debug (DFD) logic and issues Experience in clocking, reset, power-up sequences and power management Experience with x86 or ARM Architecture (ISA) Comfort with scripting such as Perl, Python, Ruby, Shell and/or TCL Academic Credentials BS, MS, or PhD degree in Electrical, Computer Engineering, or related field of study. LOCATION: Austin, TX Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD together we advance_ Datacenter Domain Sr. Program Manager The Role The requisition is for a Domain Sr. Program Manager role in Datacenter GPU Systems Engineering Organization. This individual will be responsible for end-to-end support of AMD’s accelerator products, from post-GA to End-of-Life. Responsibilities include driving the execution of post product launch endeavors where different deliverables are coming from different engineering functions across AMD. These multidisciplinary teams will be comprised of post-Silicon validation engineering, BIOS development, chief engineering, board operations, driver development, use-case validation, quality, yield product engineering, business operation, customer engineering etc. With keeping the big picture view of end-to-end program plan and execution, you are expected to coordinate dependencies among different engineering teams to make sure all the intermediary milestones are being met and execution remains on track. Success of the program will be defined as meeting or beating the scope, schedule and spend of the program. The applicant must be a team player with a strong ability to build rapport with multi-tiered stakeholders, a commitment to meeting deadlines, and an aptitude to thrive in a fast paced, multi-tasking environment. Key Responsibilities Primary support contact in sustaining for internal stakeholders Foster relationships and manage customer expectations to ensure needs are aligned with AMD business goals and revenue objectives Maintain awareness of, and provide status reports on, program schedule, status, and key issues Identify program risks and develop mitigation plans Manage customer critical issues and escalations Manage customer sampling requirements in development Align with AMD cross-functional teams (Business Unit, Sales, Engineering) on customer engagement, with emphasis on driving technical enablement/communications, technical support, and debug/issue resolution Qualifications Strong experience in program management Experience driving product development with hardware platforms and related software ecosystem. Well-versed with different project management tools Good breadth and strong technical knowledge (SoC, BIOS, Platforms, SW, Tools, Manufacturing) and experience in overall product stack and not just limited to silicon. Excellent communication skills. Excellent skills of managing up with right set of data/reports to executives for visibility and decision making. Ability to align, resolve conflicts and build consensus among parties working towards the final goal. High sense of urgency and drive for results. Relentless focus on customer satisfaction. Experience in creating and deploying processes for efficiency and scalability Experience working in a multi-site and multi-cultural environment The ability to objectively analyze information, synthesize data, and draw a rational conclusion Highly organized, able to prioritize, and juggle multiple work streams to tight deadlines Excellent written and verbal communication and expertise in Microsoft Office tools (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Teams) Seasoned in leveraging MS Project, Excel, Share Point, Teams for clear communication and coordination of work. Ability to network quickly and independently to align resources towards a common goal. Ways To Stand Out Strong understanding of the general silicon engineering process, from concept to tape-out to production Proven track record of enabling several NPI programs resulting in successful products. Comfortable defining and implementing complex program with intimate understanding of dependencies, critical paths, key and critical landmarks, and results. Knowledge of GPU technologies, HPC, or AI ecosystem is a plus. Academic Credentials BS in EE, CE, or CS PMP certification is a nice to have LOCATION: Austin, TX (remote, hybrid) Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD together we advance_ Datacenter Systems Application Engineer The Role The Datacenter GPU System Engineering team is seeking a Principal Application Engineer. In this customer-focused role, you will be working with the world’s leading High-Performance Compute (HPC) GPUs being designed into exascale class supercomputers. You will be working directly with key OEM partners, field application teams, internal development teams, and other stakeholders to bring a portfolio of next-generation Server Platforms to market using AMD’s Instinct™ Accelerators and support them post- production. Key Responsibilities Manage technical interaction with OEM/ODM Partners to enable deployment of AMD Instinct™ Accelerators in Partner systems. Support Partners in the bring-up and qualification of AMD Instinct™ GPUs in their system, guide partners on use of AMD tools, qualification test methods, and analysis of test results. Lead the debug of Partner/Customer issues (HW, firmware, driver), working with a cross-functional team and driving the root cause investigation. Work with Partners on the development of manufacturing/screen tests to ensure reliability at scale. Understand Partner requirements and schedule, identify gaps in AMD offering and work with other stakeholders to close them. Author design guideline, technical presentations, and training material. Provide recommendation to improve customer experience with our SW and HW. Key Experience Experience in Datacenter system design, board design, validation, or Application Engineering, preferably in external customer facing roles. Strong knowledge in PC/server architecture and interfaces, experience with system level debug. Strong System Level debugging skills with hands-on experiences in performing HW debug, SI analysis, and performance optimizations on various system architectures. Understanding and experience working with Enterprise Linux environment (Ubuntu, CentOS/RHEL and SLES). Excellent oral and written communication skills to communicate technical results clearly and accurately. Preferred Experience Test or design experience in system interconnect technologies (PCIe, XGMI, CXL, USB, I/O Controllers) Familiarity with various deployment models including cloud, virtualization and containers. Automation, orchestration, delivery via Kubernetes, Docker, or Mesos. Experience or knowledge of server firmware/BIOS settings, boot process, server monitoring and management SW. Experience relating to power and thermal management. Solid knowledge of Shell/BASH, C/C++, Python, or other framework. Experience with OpenCL, CUDA, or ROCm is a plus. Academic Credentials BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science. MS or PhD a plus. jobTitle: Deep Learning Library GPU Software Development Engineer
jobDescription: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. AMD together we advance_ The Role AMD is looking for an individual to join a hardworking team developing Deep Learning and High-Performance Computing GPU kernels on the AMD Radeon Open Compute (ROCm) platform (https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform) and MIOpen, AMD's Deep Learning primitives library which provides highly-optimized implementations of different operators. The Person The successful person will be an experienced GPU-compute programmer with experience in LLVM compiler and an eye toward hardware-aware performance optimizations. Key Responsibilities The ideal candidate will be responsible for writing high-performance GPU kernels for AMD’s Machine Learning and Deep Learning Library: MIOpen (https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/MIOpen) They will be porting and optimizing algorithms for new GPU hardware Perform code reviews, build unit tests, author detailed documentation related to their work, and work with on-site and offshore teams to deliver the software solutions on schedule They will play a key role in all phases of the software development including system requirements analysis, coordinating feature design and development across functional and organizational boundaries Preferred Experience Strong programming skills in C/C++; experience with CUDA programming and CUTLASS preferred Experience with LLVM Compiler, and compiler optimization techniques for GPU computing is preferred Experience or knowledge about BLAS operators and GEMM optimization. Knowledge of Computer Architect and GPU architect Experience using version control software such as Git Strong understanding of Linux internals, Servers, and Debugging Basic knowledge of software development lifecycle, SW practices including debugging, test, revision control, documentation, and bug tracking Good teamwork and interpersonal skills required Ability to work independently and within complementary teams Demonstrate flexibility, strong motivation, and a proven track record of meeting results-oriented deadlines Knowledge with deep neural network machine learning technologies and modern machine learning programming frameworks Experience working with and developing virtualization containers and package managers for code deployment Academic Credentials Bachelor’s or master’s degree in related discipline preferred Location: Austin, TX Santa Clara, CA Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team. AMD together we advance_ The Role We are looking for our next team member to join the Enterprise Business Unit to support field engineering engagement with our customers in the Austin, TX area. The focus of this role will be to drive new OEM, channel, and partner opportunities for the Datacenter/Server market and to help AMD drive a new era of computing into the datacenter. You will be required to engage with the customer(s) and partner(s) as needed, and to demonstrate how AMD technology can support the needs of their business. The FAE in this role will have a special focus on pre-sales activity to support and drive new design activity into different areas of our partner’s business. The FAE in this role will also provide development support activity as opportunities transition from feasibility and design win to development and production phases. Working with the Server Sales Team and the Field Engineering Director, you will be responsible for all aspects of the technical engagement required to support sales and account objectives. The Person Does this sound like you? We would love to talk! Proven track record in CPU and server system architecture, server benchmarks, GPU computing, and server platform enablement Broad technical understanding of server CPUs, platform architecture and the development process needed to successfully bring a server-based product to production Excellent problem-solving, time-management, prioritization, and organizational skills, able to lead complex problems, involving multi-disciplined, multi-functional teams and many priorities at once Excellent collaborative skills, and ability to work independently or as part of a team Outstanding oral and written communication skills and demonstrated success in building strong technical relationships (internal: Sales, Marketing, Engineering and external: OEM) Able to lift up to 50 lbs. (racking hardware) Main Focus Key Responsibilities: Develop technical relationships with target customer base Win new AMD server opportunities with target customers Support customer engineering teams throughout server development process Drive customer feedback into AMD sales, business unit and engineering teams More Day To Day Will Include Provide technical guidance to sales personnel and the customer in the evaluation, design and development of AMD based server and/or data center solutions or other vertical targets as identified by sales leadership. Partner with sales in determining possible application of our products and solutions to meet customer requirements. Align with AMD Sales, Architecture, Development, CTO, Business Unit, and other relevant teams as needed to accomplish account goals. Perform technical presentations, training and updates for customers, partners, and prospects. Translate customer business issues and requirements into technical solution opportunities/engagements that best demonstrate our product offerings. Keep abreast of the competitive landscape and clearly articulate the technical differentiation and value proposition associated with AMD versus its competitors. Keep up-to-date on relevant competitive solutions and work with internal teams to provide responses where needed Assist with the solution development/architectural design to meet specific customer needs. Analyze customer product solutions and evaluate product performance based on market requirements. Understand and articulate AMD based technology offerings across multiple verticals (e.g. Storage, Networking, Telco, Embedded) Partner with other AMD and vendor domain specialists to build specific customer solutions. Install and test solutions in-house, as required, to ensure successful deployments and evaluations. Lead technical engagements with customers to support design win opportunities. Architect and document technical solutions that are aligned with customer objectives. Lead efforts to define, scope and document technical requirements and customer expectations for opportunities of interest. Provide hands-on, expert-level technical assistance to customer development and software teams. Define, implement, and manage customer evaluations and Proof of Concepts as needed to demonstrate AMD product features and performance. Be a credible authority to OEM on direct and indirect product capabilities. Preferred Experience If this sounds like your background, we should talk. A Specialized Knowledge Of Server Software Environments Including Operating Systems (Windows, Linux), Compilers, Benchmarks, And Targeted Applications That May Be Used To Validate Server Platforms For The Following Cloud and datacenter computing Data management and analytics (Spark, Oracle, SAP) High Performance Computing (HPL, SPEC, STREAM, OpenMP/MPI) Software Defined Storage (IOMeter, IOZone, HDFS, CEPH) Additionally, We Are Seeking Proven experience in server platform architecture and/or platform development experience Firm understanding of platform development process from concept to production. Proficient in server software ecosystem (ie: OS/Hypervisors, Compilers, Libraries, debug tools, development tools and validation workloads). Knowledgeable in platform firmware features (BIOS, BMC, SMU). Hands-on experience and strong expertise in server hardware ecosystem at the node, rack and datacenter level. Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the setup and configuration of server systems including software, networking and storage infrastructure. Experience with virtualization technology and one or more hypervisor solutions Someone with the desire to continuously learn Academic Credentials BS or Advanced degree with proven professional experience (degree should be in a Technical field - e.g. Engineering or Computer Science) preferred Location: Austin, TX area Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

The individual will help design, develop, and use simulation and/or formal based verification environments, at block and full-chip level, to prove the functional correctness of Network-on-Chip (NoC), System-level Quality of Service (QoS) and DDR, LPDDR, and HBM Memory Controller IP designs. The Person Your experience and expertise in developing advance SystemVerilog and UVM based testbench and Automation that can scale with Full-Chip will enable improved execution of AMD’s devices and productivity. Candidate is expected to be a strong team player with good communication skills and one who is able to positively and strategically assist the Memory Controller design team with an eye towards improving overall product quality. Key Responsibilities Collaborate with Architecture, Design, and Software teams to prove that the system-level architecture requirements are met as part of Pre-Si Functional Verification. Work includes Test Planning, testbench architecture, execution, tracking, coverage closure, and delivery to programs. Preferred Experience The ideal candidate is one who has a proven track record on driving strategies and successful verification execution of NoC, Crossbar switches, analyzed and verified system-level Performance and QoS requirements. Requires strong understanding of AXI protocol, NoC architecture, DRAM memory controllers, especially DDR4/5, LPDDR4/5, and HBM2/2E/3. Require proven track record in technical leadership of teams with 5+ engineers. This includes planning, execution, tracking, verification closure, and delivery to programs. Requires experience with development of UVM/OVM and/or Verilog, System Verilog test benches and usage of simulation tools/debug environments such as Synopsys VCS, Cadence IES to verify Full-Chip FPGA designs and memory controller IPs. Requires strong understanding of state of the art of verification techniques, including assertion and coverage-driven verification. Experience as a verification architect, establishing the verification methodology, tools and infrastructure for high performance IP and/or VLSI designs is a plus. Requires a familiarity with verification management tools as well as understanding of database management particularly as it pertains to regression management. Experience with FPGA programming and software is a plus. Experience with formal property checking tools such as Cadence (IEV), Jasper and Synopsys (Magellan / VC Formal) is a plus. Experience with gate-level simulation, power-aware verification, reset verification, contention checking is a plus. Experience with silicon debug at the tester and board level is a plus. Academic Credentials Requires BS w/ 3+ yrs or MS w/ 1+ yrs or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science. Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. jobDescription: What You Do At AMD Changes Everything At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center. Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team. Senior Design Engineer DFT Architecture and RTL The Role AMD is seeking a Processor DFT Architect and subject matter expert to design and develop custom DFT (Design-For-Test) microarchitecture for our next-generation IPs and processors. The ideal candidate is experienced in the microprocessor development process, resolution of critical problems, and has a consistent track record of delivering timely and high-quality products. Cutting edge experience in DFT architecture and design, utilizing the latest process technologies, is preferred. The candidate demonstrates a deep understanding of unique silicon reliability and quality requirements to bring mission critical products to market. Key Responsibilities Conceptualize and drive the definition of Design-For-Test Microarchitecture for our next-generation high-performance CPU cores and related IP; meet the highest quality standards of cloud and embedded computing. Collaborate with DFT stakeholders – ATPG engineers, SOC and other DFT IP experts, Product & Platform Engineering, Processor Architects and process technology experts – to define DFT solutions that ensure the highest levels of silicon quality and reliability. Overcome challenges that intersect DFT technology and product development. Implementation level specification, microarchitecture design and RTL implementation of custom Design for Test (DFT) solutions. Collaborate with design verification to validate and ensure production level deployment of features - enabling testability, diagnostics, and high quality. Collaborate with physical design engineers to achieve high frequency and low power; comprehending challenges of the latest cutting-edge fabrication technologies. Develop technical strategies for DFT. Demonstrate subject matter expertise. Actively participate in the external DFT community. Preferred Experience Breadth and depth of experience in DFT design, methodology and the latest trends in high-performance microprocessor designs. Evangelize DFT solutions and methodologies, technical leadership and mentoring of senior staff. Experience must include Verilog RTL development with industry tools in a CPU, GPU, or similarly complex semiconductor product. Demonstrates Expertise In The Following Design-for-test microarchitecture, including scan test, memory built-in self test (MBIST), logic built-in self test (LBIST), and test access with JTAG and IEEE1500 standard logic. Register transfer language (RTL) coding for high-speed designs. Logic design or custom circuit design. Exposure to design verification methods. Experience with physical design, synthesis, place and route, static timing analysis, and power closure. Problem-solving and debugging skills. Excellent communication and technical documentation skills. Other Experience That Add Value Experience with clocking, reset, power-up sequences, and power management logic. Experience with design for debug (DFD) and design for manufacturability (DFM). Comfort with scripting such as Python, Ruby, Perl, Shell or TCL Patents and Publications on DFT. Academic Credentials And Experience MS or PhD in EE/CE/CS and 15+ years of relevant work experience LOCATION: Santa Clara, CA USA Requisition Number: 124741 Country: United States State: California City: Santa Clara Job Function: Design Hiring Manager: Karlo R Arriola AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. We consider candidates regardless of age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status. Please click here for more information.

DFT Design Verification Engineer The Role Our candidate will be an experienced engineer who is passionate about applying Verification skills and technologies to verify Design For Test (DFT) logic. Our microprocessors are designed using next generation process technologies and operate at extremely high frequencies - demanding custom DFT solutions. AMD’s Embedded Business is part of AECG (Adaptive and Embedded Computing Group). Product line program management requires you to drive the execution of entire product stack where different deliverables are coming from different engineering teams/functions across AMD. These functions will be pre-silicon, SoC Engineering, Post-Silicon validation, BIOS development, reference boards, board operations, driver development, use-case validation, quality, yield product engineering etc. With keeping the big picture view of end-to-end program plan and execution, you should co-ordinate and iron-out dependencies among different engineering teams to make sure all the intermediary milestones are being met and execution remains on track. Success of the program will be defined as meeting or beating the scope, schedule and spend of the program. Key Responsibilities Lead the product program management team with exceptional leadership and scale the team in competency and bandwidth for increasing number and scope of the programs. Provide strong oversight and guidance to all the program managers for different product line programs and drive to sort out any dependencies or other bottlenecks in those programs. Make sure the programs follow their execution metrics and any changes are tackled with agility and quick planning. Coordinate and drive the concept, feasibility and planning exit milestones with the full ownership of securing right approvals from the senior management on those gate reviews. Drive key initiatives for the BU level challenges like yield improvements, improving DPPMs and adoption of methodologies like ASPICE. As part of the program execution, prepare end-to-end plan starting with the NPI phases for planning, execution and then post-NPI phases of derivative programs. Craft and deploy lightweight processes for strong rigor/discipline to constantly uplevel the execution focus and efficiency. Lead and drive these process adoptions across the overall program management org. Manage and handle escalations with a sense of urgency and proactive problem solving. Prepare and present program status reports to executive and highlighting risks, data for pros cons analysis of decision making. Drive cross functional alignment among different teams including the other program managers. Share best practices with other product program management organizations. Experience in leading a team of NPI program managers at director level or above and creating/deploying processes for efficiency and scale. Strong Program Management and Execution skills and well-versed with different project management tools. Good breadth and strong technical knowledge (SoC, BIOS, Platforms, SW, Tools, Manufacturing) and experience in overall product stack and not just limited to silicon. Proven track record of enabling several NPI programs resulting in successful products. Experience working in a multisite and multi-cultural environment and ability to travel as needed. Team player with passion and hunger to do whatever it takes for business success. Automotive product experience will be a big-plus. Excellent communication skills. Excellent skills of managing up with right set of data/reports to executives for visibility and decision making. Ability to align, resolve conflicts and build consensus among parties working towards the final goal. High sense of urgency and drive for results. Relentless focus on customer satisfaction. AMD together we advance_ Fellow – Datacenter Solutions Group Software Architect The Role AMD is searching for a Fellow, Software Architect, Datacenter Solutions Group. This individual will be part of the DSG (Data Center Solutions Group) Architecture and Strategy team – comprised of seasoned system engineers spanning hardware and software, from node level to rack level design, from BIOS and security to cloud native cloud computing, from memory technologies to high performance fabrics, from 5G to Automotive to Server/Storage, Cloud and more. The DSG Architecture and Strategy team goal is to inform and influence AMDs leading SOCs (CPU/GPU/DPU, HW/SW), optimized for the vision of the future, via collaboration with internal stakeholders, customers, end users, and strategic partners. The Person Ideal candidates will have broad and deep system technology backgrounds, experience developing, influencing, and collaborating on strategy. Ability to translate workload/application trends to system, hardware, software, SOC implications across the entire stack. Ability to translate highly technical concepts into actionable plans. Ability to drive hands on proof of concepts to collect data and facts. Exceptional communication skills to address multiple internal and external stakeholders. Skill in analyzing tradeoffs and making analytical, fact-based recommendations that have substantial technical, business, and financial impacts. Ability to guide product definition using credible insights developed by interacting with end customers, ISVs/IHVs, and strategic partners. Ability to build relationships with strategic customers and partners to ensure that AMD enterprise and embedded products are built to match the evolving needs of the market. Collaboration skills to engage a team of engineering, product management and business development professionals to achieve outstanding business results. Key Responsibilities Drive workload and application-level strategies internally and with industry partners / ecosystem. Partner with SoC design teams and product management in providing a unified and clear platform / system level vision to influence AMDs SoC roadmap. Partner with SoC design teams on future x86 enhancements (ISA, security, virtualization, platform level technologies) for the emerging future Partner with SoC design team and business units on software architecture, features and enabling requirements Represent AMD datacenter system level vision in industry consortiums, events and strategic partnerships. Work with OEMs, end customers, ISV/IHV partners to drive workload and use case plans that facilitate joint roadmap definition. Preferred Experience Desired candidates will have experience in some of the areas below: Systems architecture for Enterprise, Cloud, Embedded, Storage, HPC, Edge, 5G, AI, Auto x86 uArchitecture, virtualization, security IO and Memory architecture Networking & IO (SmartNics, Fabrics, NVMeoF, PCIe, CxL….) Storage & Media (Flash, Storage class memory, DDRx, NVMe, NVMeoF….) Management (BMC, DC-SCM, RedFish, LinuxBoot, OpenBMC, Telemetry….) Academic Credentials BS/MS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering LOCATION: Austin Texas preferred Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD together we advance_ The Position The Infinity Fabric team is looking for a recent college graduate to fill an entry level pre-silicon design verification engineer position. In this role, you will help ensure the functional quality of Infinity Fabric design, and improve the verification environment and methodology to support new types of AMD products. Design verification engineers are responsible for developing test cases, bus functional models and functional checks using object-oriented System Verilog and the UVM verification library. Team members also document and execute test plans consisting of new tests, functional checks and coverage. The goal is to find functional bugs in design components before those components are delivered into the larger system and eventually sent to manufacturing. The team is based in Boxboro MA, and collaborates with teams across the globe. Engineers interact with architects, RTL designers, design verification engineers, performance engineers, and post-silicon validation engineers and have opportunities to develop deep expertise in parts of the Infinity Fabric architecture and ASIC design methodology. The Person Ideally you bring the following qualifications to our team: Education A minimum of a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science with a focus on computer architecture Experience Have exposure to using Verilog, SystemVerilog, and UVM via coursework or preferably internship or other work experience. Have a strong background in computer architecture and object-oriented software development. Scripting in languages such as Perl, Python or Ruby. Capabilities Be comfortable interacting with a diverse set of colleagues, and across different geographies Self-motivated to solve problems, and proactive to get help when needed. Good communication skills Good documentation skills Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. The Data Fabric is the high-bandwidth, high performance fabric network logic that ties together all the IPs on an SOC. Every product that AMD sells has its own custom-designed Data Fabric, so this role gives an engineer the opportunity to work on a broad array of products that address a variety of markets, including traditional servers, high performance computing, client desktop and laptop PCs, machine intelligence, graphics, console gaming, embedded, and customer-specific applications. jobTitle: Manager Power Systems Design Engineering, Datacenter GPU and Accelerated Processing
jobDescription: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team. AMD together we advance_ The Role As the Manager, Power Systems Design Engineering in the Datacenter and GPU Accelerated Processing Division, you will be responsible for the board power system design and development for AMD products in this expanding and strategic market for AMD. You will interact with other key engineering teams such as silicon design, packaging, board design, signal integrity, thermal/mechanical, platform validation, and manufacturing and leaders within AMD, customers, suppliers, and partners. In the Advanced System and Power team, we design high-technology platforms for world-class products based on AMD’s Graphics Processing Units (GPU’s). Our team plays a major part in architecting and shaping every graphics board offered by AMD. We design cutting-edge power converters for our discrete graphics boards that retail around the world. Facing always more stringent demands in terms of the current level, efficiency, and responsiveness, these designs are essential to maximize the performance from our GPU’s in an efficient and cost-effective manner. The Person The Manager of Power Systems Design Engineering team will have excellent communication skills, planning skills, technical expertise, is a team player, possesses broad managerial/technical leadership skills` and critical problem solving and trouble shooting skills, is a self-starter and is well organized. They will be market savvy and comfortable in a multi-tasking environment. Key Responsibilities The Manager of Board Design/Electrical Engineering will be responsible for developing and leading a team of 5-10 engineers in a highly focused global engineering team based in Austin, Texas. The successful candidate will have a board engineering and power systems development background and work as part of a global team in delivering commercially viable products (silicon to systems) to the marketplace in a timely and cost-effective manner. Other Responsibilities Include The manager will lead his team to work with other cross-functional teams to design and implement a full power delivery network, model and validate PDN impedance and droop targets, and verify power supply integrity using lab and in-situ silicon measurements. The candidate is expected to work and guide the system’s design team to provide optimum component selection and detailed layout guidelines during the design execution phase. In addition, the candidate is expected to work with the Board Validation team to develop test plans/procedures to perform system-level validation for characterizing design margins on the power domains. Work with SoC and System Architects and external industry to drive the latest power delivery technologies and innovations for computers and electronics industry Analyze and compare solutions, and then drive team insights and architecture forward into system implementation, SoC silicon, and power delivery silicon. Conduct feasibility studies and work with development teams to deliver solutions. The Manager will manage work assignments and coordinate results cross-functionally, and globally, responsible for building and motivating a high-performance team as well as developing key relationships with OEM/ODM customers. In addition, at a technical level the person will be able to direct technical work within the team as well as mentor and develop employees within the team. The position includes focusing on the technology development and productization of new product architectures and features, packaging technologies, and power regulation solutions at a board and system level for AMD’s products. This role requires considerable use of initiative and independent judgment. This role will also be a key person representing the team and its activities in program and platform core teams. The selected candidate will have the ability to ‘influence’ and effectively communicate their vision throughout the organization. They will be a driver of continuous improvement and new ways of thinking by promoting new ideas/perspectives around power design, architectures, and product definition. Qualifications Proven technical understanding of power supply architectures and PDN in server, OAM, and PCIe environments Understanding and experience with multi-phase buck/buck-boost regulators, digital PWM controllers, bus converters, LDOs, PMICs, charge pumps, ADCs & DACs, etc. Working knowledge of 2D/2.5D EM simulation tools such as Sigrity’s PowerDC, PowerSI, SiWave or equivalent\ Strong knowledge of high frequency magnetics design for power electronics Printed circuit board design experience is a must Expertise in schematic capture, PCB design tools such as OrCAD or Allegro Ability to work with multiple cross functional teams to make the right trade-offs on system level performance Excellent knowledge of control theory, closed loop compensation, stability analysis, phase margin, etc. Proficiency with lab equipment such as oscilloscope, eload, function generator, etc. Experience with analog circuit modeling and simulation tools (e.g. Simplis, PSpice, HSpice etc.) required Must have good written and verbal communication skills Knowledge of AMD’s SVIx power management interface Academic Credentials B.S is required, M.S preferred Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. These systems are deployed in a wide variety of applications in communications, automotive, medical, aerospace and defense, test and measurement and more. Fully integrated with our industry leading Vivado Design Suite, Vivado IP Integrator is the next generation environment for graphical, correct-by-construction, IP centric system design. Built from the ground up using cutting edge industry standard technologies, IP Integrator delivers powerful capabilities such as intelligent auto-connection of IP interfaces, Designer Assistance, one-click IP subsystem generation and real-time DRCs combined with powerful verification and debug capabilities. Used in conjunction with our rich IP catalog and their own IP, customers can construct sophisticated processor and non-processor systems without ever writing a line of RTL code. AMD together we advance_ The Role This is a great opportunity to develop and maintain world-class hardware physical design flow in a fast-paced production environment on the very edge of modern technology! The goal of our Silicon CAD team at AMD is to determine a set of standards and techniques for designing chips with the highest performance, lowest cost, and lowest power usage. We then automate these best practices into a software design flow for efficiency and consistency, and work with various design teams to put the software to use in constructing next-generation GPUs, CPUs and APUs with industry-standard EDA software tools such as Synopsys IC Compiler II and Primetime. The Person You are a highly motivated self-starter, who is passionate about solving problems and reaching goals. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills and collaborate well with others on your team, as well as with other business units. Key Responsibilities Developing new flow features around new EDA tools and tool capabilities. Developing innovative physical design place & route methodology and flow solutions to meet current and future digital design challenges. Working closely with EDA vendors to evaluate their capabilities and drive future improvements to meet AMD roadmap requirements. Tuning the design flows to achieve optimal power, performance, area and turnaround time on a range of designs spanning CPU, GPU and SoC. Improving and maintaining the flow infrastructure and automation. Providing technical leadership, mentoring and customer support in a global multi-cultural work environment. Preferred Experience Experience in developing and supporting CAD flows for RTL to GDS design of multi-gigahertz digital designs. Experience with advanced process technology nodes, preferably 5nm or more recent. Extensive experience in developing and customizing high performance design flows using industry-standard EDA tools for logic and physical synthesis from Cadence, Synopsys, or a similar vendor. Experience with driving EDA vendors to make tool improvements or new functions to meet advanced or unique design requirements. Working knowledge of static timing analysis, high performance clock tree design flows, and PPA optimization methodologies is strongly preferred. Excellent UNIX and scripting programming skills (Perl, Python, and/or TCL). Experience with software build automation and version control software (e.g., Perforce, Git) is a plus. Strong teamwork, collaboration, and communication abilities, with the ability to contribute to company-wide consensus on design flows and tools. Academic Credentials Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent is preferred.
