These Xilinx products are core components that enable a wide breadth of applications from AI/vision systems to data processing networks. AMD needs thoughtful, innovative, and thorough engineers who enjoy hands-on test development and debug. Engineers, who reap satisfaction from being part of a team that can deliver world-class silicon SoC devices, should apply. Bring your Verilog simulation, emulation, and scripting skills along with your expertise and ideas to effectively prove and deliver boot, peripheral interface, and platform power domain management functionality on which customer systems can rely. The Person If you are the kind of engineer who expresses curiosity and drive to know how devices operate and why, and who takes pride in enabling a team to deliver high quality products and results, then you should apply. Key Responsibilities Define the validation architecture and design the system necessary to validate the functionality of the PMC. Arrive at a system level test plan, that involves integrated IP, external component interfaces, and internal control/data paths to analyze function of the design tools and performance of the silicon Work with the PMC architecture, design, and verification teams to identify use cases, vet specifications, capture and articulate usecase/solution details, develop pre-silicon and post-silicon test plan. Manage the team and track the project schedules to build the validation environment. Develop and track pre-silicon and post-silicon test strategies and test plans Lead the team to develop, and execute validation test cases on prototype emulation systems Own the first silicon bring-up and direct necessary debug of silicon and supporting tools Equip internal applications teams with IP/system knowledge for delivering quality software and tools. Aid internal customer support teams with expertise and experiments to overcome design blockages Preferred Experience Experience in managing a team and coordinating across cross functional organization. This role will be pivotal in bringing AMD’s next generation CPU based products into Gaming desktops, Laptops and Data Center! We have an award-winning culture and great benefits! Join our team today! The Person In this position, you will be working with a small but highly experienced team that led the silicon verification of AMD’s multi-generation Zen CPU Cores. You will be a part of a fast paced, high-performing team. If you thrive in a technically challenging environment while working on a variety of different engineering problems using cutting-edge technology, this could be the perfect opportunity for you! The ideal candidate will possess problem-solving skills, have strong communication and collaboration skills as they work with different stakeholders to understand current challenges. Key Responsibilities Research, design, develop, and/or test electronic components and systems for semiconductor and related device manufacturing, employing knowledge of electronic theory. AMD together we advance_ The Role The Memory Subsystem team is searching for a passionate, adaptable and innovative design engineer to contribute towards the next generation of HBM PHY and more. AMD / Xilinx has an opening for a Senior Hardware Design Engineer in the IP Design team. This position entails working on digital IC design development of PHY and integration of Memory subsystem blocks for next generation FPGAs. Candidate will support varied aspects of the entire design process including RTL design and functional verification, FE design flows and/or synthesis, timing closure, supporting SW views and working with test engineers on silicon verification and characterization. THE PERSON: Looking for a person who is motivated to learn and grow in the position as a Hardware Design Engineer. Someone who thrives on learning new things and wants to advance in AMD team. Being a team player working collaboratively with energy is essential! Key Responsibilities The candidate will be responsible for different design stages in the RTL to GDS implementation. The candidate will design, implementation RTL for complex digital and analog blocks using Verilog/System Verilog. The candidate will be responsible for physical design flows (synthesis with DFT) and work on Static Timing Analysis. The candidate will work closely with Functional Verification teams to support block level verification (constrained-random and/or directed verification environments using System Verilog and UVM). The candidate is expected to have strong scripting skills in Perl, Tcl, Shell and/or other languages to support existing & develop new design automation tools/flows for the varied aspects of the design implementation. The candidate is expected to work with various design groups across different disciplines in different geographical locations. The candidate is expected to have regular communication with project teams worldwide to resolve issues and ensure targeted goals. Preferred Experience RTL design implementation of Digital blocks using Verilog/System Verilog. Knowledge in VLSI design, Design Automation, IC design. Basic knowledge of EDA Tools (like Synopsys DC Compiler, Primetime, VCS, Cadence Virtuoso). Knowledge of Physical Design (floor planning, synthesis, place & route) and Static Timing Analysis is preferred. Experience with UVM/OVM and/or Verilog, System Verilog test benches, BFMs and usage of simulation tools/debug environments is preferred. Basic understanding of FPGA architecture and customer usage model is a plus. Knowledge of Cadence SPICE, IC compiler is a plus. A ‘hands-on’ role working independently and with other AMD engineers to tackle technical HPC functional and performance issues, collaborating with our customer-facing organizations, our internal R&D and other key engineering groups. The Person Very Strong solution-oriented mindset Expertise in HPC application performance testing and debug on CPU and/or GPU Strong technical ownership and ability to lead technical relationships with both customers and HPC partners Ability to independently prioritize opportunities to deliver results on time Proven success establishing relationships internally and across a network of customers and partners Excellent verbal and written communication skills Key Responsibilities Seek maximum HPC performance while achieving highest quality on AMD EPYC plus Instinct systems through a combination of performance optimization, HPC workload debug and characterization, compilers, math libraries and lower-level AMD-internal toolsets Feeding back performance bottlenecks and functional issues to the relevant engineering groups during bring-up to improve quality and performance Partner with our collaborative internal development and validation teams supporting with a deeper level of HPC application and system-level expertise Attending and leading high-value technical HPC discussions to portray general AMD GPU proposition and its application to HPC Technically owning and resolving customer and partner issues. One Team.  AMD together we advance_   SIGNAL INTEGRITY AND POWER INTEGRITY ENGINEER      THE ROLE: We are looking for a talented, self-driven and motivated Principal SI/PI Engineer with a strong experience in simulation and verification to join the System-Signal integrity and Power Integrity team of Adaptive and Embedded Computing Group in San Jose. This team provide signal integrity and power integrity support for on-die , on-interposer, on-package and on PCB for AECG products.   THE PERSON: As a principal SI/PI engineer, you will be responsible for leading PCB and RF system signal integrity and power integrity support. You will have an opportunity to work in a positive environment where individual development goals are aligned with organizational goals in developing products for some of the life changing and futuristic applications.     KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for Signal Integrity and Power Integrity simulations at feasibility, pre-layout, post-layout phases of AECG characterization board and demo board design. Establish design and layout guidelines. Responsible for coordinating with HW design team, layout team, NPI and manufacturing vendors to resolve SI/Stackup related issues Responsible for end-to-end channel simulations for multi gigabit serial lines like 56Gbps, 112Gbps and beyond. Responsible for Si and timing margin simulations of HBM/ /DDR4/LPDDR4/DDR5/LPDDR5 and other memory buses Responsible for characterizing the various interfaces in the product and verifying the simulations against measurements Responsible for preparation of and implementing checklists for various stages of PCB development. Worked with architecture team, package design team and PCB design team for future PCB technology. Update the SIPI design and analysis flow and automate the process.   PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: Minimum 10 years working experience on signal integrity and power integrity at system level of high speed digital systems. Solid understanding and experiences in computational electromagnetics and transmission line theory. Excellent experience in SIPI simulation of PCIe Gen4/5, Multi Gigabit serial buses of 112Gbps and higher, DDR4/5, LPDDR4/5 etc. Proficiency in SIPI sim tools, such as HFSS, Q3D, ADS, HSPICE, PowerSI, PowerDC etc. Working experience in PCB design tools such as Cadence Allegro Hands-on experience in electrical/design validation/compliance testing using high speed scopes, TDR, VNA, probe station and other instruments.   Excellent written and oral communication skills. Experience in RF system design (DAC and ADC) is a plus Experience in scripting Matlab/Perl/Python is a plus People Management experience is a plus   ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS: MS or Ph D in Electrical/Computer Engineering specializing in areas related to SI/PI   LOCATION: San Jose, CA     Benefits offered are described:  AMD benefits at a glance.   AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD together we advance_ The Role AMD-AECG Package Development team is looking for a dynamic, competent Senior Staff package electrical design engineer to join our growing team. As a key contributor to the success of AMD’s FPGA product, you will be part of a leading team to drive and improve AMD’s abilities to deliver the highest quality, industry leading technologies to market. The Package Development team fosters and encourages continuous technical innovation to showcase successes as well as facilitate continuous career development.  The Person The ideal candidate possesses an innovative and problem-solving mindset, has a keen eye for IC Package development, and is diligent and passionate about Technology. A successful candidate will need to employ strong knowledge in signal and power integrity of silicon and package design, leadership skills in technical areas, as well as a strong ability to compete effectively in a fast-paced, relevant environment while working with different teams of engineers and collaborators. Key Responsibilities Perform package extraction for the time domain and frequency domain analysis Provide design guidelines for the Package design Power integrity analysis for state of art package/system designs, which include but not limited to package layout model extraction, transient noise analysis (ADS, HSPICE) to meet the silicon noise spec, decoupling strategy and analysis. SSN(Simultaneous Switching Noise) analysis for I/O (DDR5, LPDDR5, etc.) power domain. Eye diagram and jitter analysis for die-package-PCB co-simulations. Signal integrity simulation and optimization on package stack-up, power/ ground plane assignment and optimization, decoupling cap locations to minimize power ground noise. Opportunity to work on high speed and RF signal trace routing, via optimization, length matching and the impact to the timing. Crosstalk analysis and reduction on-package considering mutual-effect by on-die, on-silicon interposer and on-PCB. Full-wave modeling of vias, connectors, package and PCB channels, components using 3D full-wave EM tools. Preferred Experience Solid background on transmission-line theory and computational electromagnetics. Industry working experiences on signal integrity and power integrity in one or more of signaling standards, PCIe gen4/5, PAM4/8, Ethernet, DDR5, LPDDR5, HBM2/2e/3. Experiences with SI tools, HSPICE, HFSS/Q3D, PowerSI/PowerDC, ADS or similar. Hands-on lab experiences using high speed real time scope, VNA, TDR, and spectrum analyzer will be a plus. Familiar with RF designs, high speed package designs, or high speed PCB designs will be a plus. Knowledge and experience of on-die noise model will be a plus Academic Credentials Master or Ph.D Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science; experience desired LOCATION: San Jose, CA Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. AMD together we advance_ The Role We are looking for a Senior Member of Technical Staff (SMTS) who will lead and mentor a team of verification engineers to create and execute the verification plan for a complex cutting-edge design from inception to tapeout. You will be working with architects and designers to define the verification strategy for the design, develop and review test plans, execute the test plans using industry standard tools like SystemVerilog and UVM. You will contribute to the overall success of the product and business by ensuring high quality through detail-oriented industry standard verification leading to tapeout. The Person A Senior Member of Technical Staff will be a dynamic, quality-conscious, attention oriented individual with significant experience in successfully verifying and taping out complex designs with high quality. Key Responsibilities Lead and Plan verification of complex digital design blocks by fully understanding the architecture and design specifications Interact with architects and design engineers to create a comprehensive verification test plan Design and architect testbenches in System Verilog and UVM to complete verification of the design in an efficient manner Create and enhance constrained-random and/or directed verification environments, and formally verify designs with System Verilog Assertions (SVA) and industry leading formal tools Debug tests with design engineers to deliver functionally correct design blocks Identify and write coverage measures for stimulus quality improvements Perform coverage analysis to identify verification holes and achieve closure on coverage metrics Preferred Experience Experienced with development of UVM, OVM, VMM and/or System Verilog, Verilog test benches and usage of simulation tools/debug environments like Synopsys VCS, Cadence IES to test block level/full chip SOCs and FPGAs Strong understanding of state of the art of verification techniques, including assertion and coverage-driven verification Strong understanding of different phases of ASIC and/or full custom chip development is required Experience in block level NOC (Net work on Chip) verification is a plus Verification Experience in protocols like AXI3/4, DDR4/5, HBM, PCIe, Processors, Graphics is a plus Experience as a verification architect, establishing the verification methodology, tools and infrastructure for high performance FPGAs, SOCs and/or VLSI designs is a plus Experience with gate level simulation, power verification, reset verification, contention checking, abstraction techniques is a plus Familiarity with verification management tools as well as understanding of database management particularly as it pertains to regression management is a plus Experience with formal property checking tools such as Cadence (IEV), Jasper and Synopsys (VC-Formal, Magellan) is a plus Special Qualifications: (1 year of prior work experience in each of the following:) Architect and implement verification environment using advanced verification methodology such as UVM or SystemVerilog Test plan development and test writing Analyzing and debugging failures using simulation tools such as Synopsys VCS or DVE to verify hard IPs, FPGA fabric or System-on-Chip Functional coverage writing, coverage collection and analysis, coverage closure Writing System Verilog assertions and assertion based verification Running regressions, automation using scripting languages such as PERL and verification closure Academic Credentials BS w/ 12+ yrs or MS w/ 8+ yrs or PhD w/ 5+ yrs in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering or related equivalent Compensation Range & Benefits Expected to range from $126,700 to $235,300, commensurate with experience and specific skill sets. jobTitle: SMTS Floating Point RTL Design Engineer
jobDescription: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team. AMD together we advance_ The Role This engineer will utilize their technical expertise to assist in the design of AMD’s next-generation CPU microprocessors. They will maintain and enhance existing RTL designs related to Floating Point (FP) features. Work on related projects and/or assignments as needed, to meet team goals. Propose and evaluate new features. Write detailed specifications for the RTL designs, develop quality, timely and cost-effective solutions independently. Write and maintain design to meet timing, area and power goals set for the project. Be involved in all phases of the project from concept to working with silicon validation teams. The Person A successful person in this role would possess good written and communication skills and would be able to work in a collaborative team environment working with architects, verification, physical-design, and silicon validation teams. At this level, they would need to demonstrate leadership qualities and have excellent time management skills. Key Responsibilities Collaborate with a dedicated team of engineers to define and implement FP microarchitecture for AMD CPUs. Reliably deliver a design from concept through tape-out by innovating through complex and challenging requirements. Identify customer challenges and insert a compelling AMD value proposition to address challenges. Write and maintain detailed specifications for the verification team members to use. Write and maintain external specifications for product and test teams to use. Work closely with the Physical Design team members to drive to design area, timing, and power goals. Work with product test teams during test bring up phase of the product. Make technical contributions and innovations that enable high performance, high frequency, and power efficiency on the FPs of our server, desktop, and laptop CPUs. Debug functional and electrical issues found in silicon debug utilizing silicon debug tools and techniques. Preferred Experience Strong logic design skills using Verilog HDL. Strong understanding of FP concepts in ISA and micro-architecture including out-or-order scheduling and FP specific datapaths. Proficiency with Verilog HDL. Proficiency with programming and scripting skills. Understanding of modern CPU architecture - prior experience designing shared cache, last level cache and related IPs, dispatch, load-store, and other out-of-order execution units a plus. Eagerness to learn and grow as a CPU FP engineer. Collaborate effectively towards the success of the project by working closely with logic design, physical design, and silicon validation teammates across the wider organization. Demonstrate a responsive track record of engaging with a diverse set of teams and across a broad set of technical areas to facilitate design delivery. Prior knowledge of formal verification tools and techniques a plus Academic Credentials MS w/ 6+ yrs, EE/CE LOCATION: Fort Collins, Colorado Compensation Range And Benefits Expected to range from $126,700 to $181,000, commensurate with experience and specific skill sets. Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD together we advance_ The Role Our team works on characterizing new products in AMD's adaptive and embedded lines. The candidate will be responsible for leading the team in programmable logic and interconnect performance characterization. This involves working closely with foundry and technology engineers and performance modeling teams to find the best transistor targeting to balance speed and power. And it involves deep data analysis to use small sets of imperfect data to interpret reality and predict effects of changes. The Person The candidate should have a strong analytic mind with a sense of leadership to guide cross functional team members to make the best decisions with imperfect data. Guide and mentor junior engineers. AMD together we advance_ The Role The AMD AEComputing Methodology team is seeking an experienced engineer to help investigate, develop, and deploy new techniques to optimize and analyze SOC timing and power to help create the next generation of Adaptive and Embedded silicon products including FPGA, APUs, DPUs, AIE and IO subsystems, Monolithic and 3D SOCs to give unparalleled flexibility to AMD customers. AMD is looking for a strong candidate who can bring in disruptive ideas that will ensure that AMD silicon is best in class. As a member of our team, you’ll be responsible for collaborating with experts across various aspects of the SOC design flow, including, but not limited to Physical Design, Timing Closure, EMIR analysis, Power analysis to tape-out in the most advanced process nodes. In our group, your work will have widespread and immediate impact on the ongoing projects. The Person You are a forward-thinking self-motivated engineer who continuously works to optimize/improve the workflow, anticipates technical issues, has deep analytical and problem-solving skills, and enjoys a competitive pace. In addition, you have strong written and verbal skills, strong presentation skills, strong problem-solving skills, and have an exceptional attention to detail. Key Responsibilities Analyze existing PD, Timing and EMIR flows and methodologies and identify weaknesses and areas for improvement Tuning the design flows to achieve optimal power, performance, area and turnaround time on a range of designs spanning FPGA, AIE, APU, DPU cores, NOC, SOCs and 3D Partner with design, technology and architecture teams to drive changes that improve PPA and TAT Coordinate the efforts of physical design, timing and EMIR engineers, CAD engineers, and EDA vendors to deliver a leading edge, SOC design methodologies Solve design and tool problems with ground-breaking approaches and champion innovation across the organization Foster collaboration and knowledge sharing through technical presentations towards peers and management Preferred Experience VLSI Circuit Design and ASIC design flow High Speed logic design and synthesis Timing Analysis and Optimization Electromigration and IR Drop analysis Low Power design Techniques Tool Driven Place and route Experience with Physical design and analysis tools such as ICC2, Primetime, Nanotime, Redhawk, Totem Experience with tool scripting Perl, Python and TCL are preferred Excellent communication skills (both written and oral) Self-motivated, and committed to achievement Academic Credentials BS/MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related LOCATION: San Jose, California Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. PROGRAM TERM: Spring 2023 (January 9 or January 16, 2023 – May 12, 2023) What You’ll Be Doing AMD is an innovative technology company dedicated to collaborating with customers and partners to ignite the next generation of computing and graphics solutions. AMD designs and develops cutting-edge computer and graphics processing technology that is used throughout the world in business, enterprise, and consumer markets. Working on our dynamic team of engineers offers a tremendous professional development opportunity to: Develop your technical abilities in a very specialized and rewarding field, Become a proactive team member that shows initiative and innovation, Learn to communicate effectively in professional team environment, Network with like-minded, experienced engineers, and Contribute novel and valuable ideas for the benefit of the team. Now is the time to unleash your knowledge and show the world what you can really do! Make your education count by coming to work at AMD. As a Co-op student, you can make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of advanced packaging technology. We have a dynamic, high-energy work environment, filled with expert level employees and unique opportunities to develop your career. With AMD, you can get the hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge in the workforce. Put that classroom theory into practice and get an inside look at AMD's technical teams, work style and culture. You will enjoy an enriching learning experience during your work term at AMD, with managers, supervisors and colleagues who are all enthusiastic to mentor you. You'll work side-by-side with a team contributing to AMD's success. Advanced Packaging is responsible for ensuring AMD has the latest and greatest packaging technology available to support future product introductions. We work with our OSAT and packaging material suppliers to ensure our mutual success. Our team designs and evaluates packaging test vehicles to ready new technology for product design. Typical areas of activity are package design, thermal interface materials, new package platform development, and production support. Advanced Packaging works horizontally to support all AMD product business units. The purpose of this position is to work with an experienced team of packaging development engineers to forward progress in bringing new packaging technology to reality by working with AMD supplier partners. Activities will include project scoping, supplier interaction, experimental data analysis, and communication through the greater AMD Packaging team. Key Responsibilities Assist Product Development Engineers in scoping new development projects. Evaluate and benchmark semiconductor packaging materials (substrates, thermal interface materials, adhesives, epoxy mold compounds, etc.) Work with suppliers and internal team members to analyze experimental reports, apply improvements, and communicate status. Interface with test, failures analysis, design, thermal, and product development engineers to further the project goals. Key Qualifications Materials Science and Engineering Familiarity with packaging structure Semiconductor theory What Would Set You Apart Advanced Packaging platforms are a plus! Who We’re Looking For Strong organizational, computer and communication skills Drive to succeed - we expect our team members to engage with a passion! AMD together we advance_ Job Title: Spring 2023 Advanced Technology Engineering Co-Op/Intern JOB LOCATION: Austin, Texas ONSITE: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. PROGRAM TERM: Spring 2023 (January 9 or January 16, 2023 – May 12, 2023) What You’ll Be Doing As a Co-op/Intern you can get hands-on experience and make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations. You will have unique opportunities to develop your career, connect with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. FTO is responsible for ensuring AMD has the latest and greatest process technology available to support future product introductions. We work with our foundry suppliers to ensure our mutual success. Our team designs and builds test chips into the new technology to ensure it is ready for high volume production. Typical areas of activity are design, testing, quality, reliability, yield analysis and production support. FTO works horizontally across several functional organizations and is a key enabler for ensuring AMD market success on subsequent products. Be prepared, FTO is fast paced and provides opportunities to contribute across multiple disciplines. The purpose of this position is to expedite the validation and ramp on advanced technology. Contributions will span many areas including methodology development, device characterization, statistical analysis, and data interpretation. As a key member of the team, you will have clearly defined deliverables that tie directly to the company's success. You will learn to work in a fast-paced global technical team environment. You will see how the work you do can benefit the next generation of advanced Si manufacturing technology. You will become very familiar with the inner workings of AMD and its suppliers. AMD together we advance_ ARCHITECTURE MODELING (AM) INTERN ADD JOB LOCATION: Santa Clara, CA ONSITE: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. Program Term This role is for Spring 2023 Start Date is January 9 or January 16, 2023 – May 12, 2023 What You’ll Be Doing The Architectural Modeling (AM) tool is the single simulator for all graphics products at AMD. The tool is utilized to predict the performance of the next-gen product across different GPU families at AMD. The role of the Engineer/Scientist can be of four different categories.   Problem identification: Data from the AM tool is used by AMD architects used to identify points that can be enhanced in our next-gen products. AM team develops a variety of tools and datapoints makes finding performance problems easier. Feature Development: The AM team works with architects on ideas, called features, to improve the graphics architecture. The AM team has the core responsibility of proving or disproving new features inclusion in next-gen products. Model Development: As an AM engineer you will develop the knowledge of the entire graphics and compute pipeline for all our off-the-shelve products, and details of the upcoming changes and their impact. Model Enhancement: AM is a C++ simulator, with python postscripts for data visualization. As an AM engineer you would get the chance to bring your expertise in these languages to improve the AM tools in terms of wall-clock runtime, memory consumption, and complexity. SW Shift Left: Help drive our SW shift initiative where we have a model and driver stack to facilitate our architecture analysis and IP verification needs. Key Qualifications Architect, model and analyze hardware and software features to improve products performance, abilities, and cost. Develop tools and algorithms to identify and eliminate performance limiters Design, implement, assess, document and test new features for next-gen products Be a developer, leader, and owner of the Architectural Modeling Tool What Would Set You Apart Programming skills in C++ and python Hardware architecture experience Experience of modeling and simulation tools Experience of GPU architecture, drivers and/or compilers is a plus Experience of GPU general-purpose computing is a plus Experience of D3D, Vulcan and OpenGL graphics applications is a plus Experience of OpenCL/CUDA/ROCm development is a plus Who We’re Looking For As a GPU modeling engineer, you will work in a hardware/software codesign environment to craft industry leading simulation platforms and tools, have a strong voice in next generation of AMD products, and get to learn and contribute to the entire graphics pipeline and software/hardware stack. The ideal candidate is a highly skilled software designer and engineer, who is proficient in C++, and familiar with hardware architecture. Knowledge of the GPU hardware and the efficient use of discrete GPUs, APUs, and mobile devices is an advantage. The candidate will work in a big team environment on a variety of opportunities, so teamwork and drive are essential. Currently pursuing a Bachelor of Science degree with emphasis in Electrical Engineering, Computer architecture, or Computer Science with relevant experience preferred Currently pursuing a Master or PhD degree with emphasis in Electrical Engineering, Computer architecture, or Computer Science Benefits Healthcare coverage, dental and vision Paid holidays Relocation stipend Education assistance for required Co-op/Intern course Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. Spring: Start Date January 9 or January 16, 2023 – May 12, 2023 What You’ll Be Doing Training deep learning models on general-purpose graphics processing units (GPGPU) resulting in a multitude of different signal outputs, including (but not limited to) loss landscape data, power consumption, and kernel execution statistics. These signals are highly informative to the process of optimizing algorithm performance, and may also be used to inform the future-state design of the GPGPU itself. Importantly however, sophisticated methods of statistical inquiry are necessary to reliably parse these insights from raw data, at scale. Develop methods based on unsupervised learning, anomaly detection, and data visualization to parse important performance insights from GPGPU data returned from a range of different deep learning workloads. Develop analysis and algorithmic methods for insight delivery, and Incorporation of these capabilities within the framework of an internal performance profiling toolset currently being developed by the DC GPU Performance team. Program Term Spring: Start Date May 15, 2023 - August 11, 2023 A multi-term commitment is preferred (ie. Spring+Summer, Summer+Fall) What You’ll Be Doing Assist Product Development Engineers in bring-up, characterization and production test program development. Focus efforts in one of three team disciplines based on interest, skills, and team needs – Yield/Test Analysis; Product Definition; or System Level Test (SLT). Perform engineering and correlation studies to ensure yield, coverage, and quality meet corporate target goal to start production ramp. Participate on cross-functional teams to improve capabilities and/or resolve production related issues. Build analysis, optimization, or reporting tools to improve our team’s efficiency, accuracy, and quality. Write and maintain technical documents to summarize results and progress. Key Qualifications Completion of 2nd year of Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering program preferred. Linux, Python, Git, and One of C, C++ or Rust is preferred. What We Do PE (Product Engineering) is developing the software tools and processes to create production tests for AMD’s next generation of products. These tools need to make it as easy as possible for engineers to generate test content that can be re-used across our product portfolio and enable a scalable test development process that can keep pace with the ever increasing complexity of our products. PEO works horizontally across several functional organizations, and is key to driving production manufacturing within time, budget, and cost constraints. PEO is a fast paced multi-tasking environment. Specialized disciplines within our team include Yield/Test Analysis, Product Definition, and System Level Test (SLT). Who We’re Looking For This is very much a hands-on position where the successful candidate will gain experience of writing software in a professional development environment and will contribute directly to some of the key features of this toolset; therefore someone with a strong interest and confidence in writing software is required. The successful candidate will be paired with two mentors, one local and one remote, and they will also learn about how test programs and individual test patterns are created, verified in simulation ahead of silicon arrival, and then finally deployed and debugged on the final product using Automated Test Equipment (ATE). The candidate will emerge from this internship well-placed to enter a future role in product, test, or design-verification engineering where they could hit the ground running by using the toolset that they originally helped to develop. FTO is responsible for ensuring AMD has the latest and greatest process technology available to support future product introductions. We work with our foundry suppliers to ensure our mutual success. Key Responsibilities Assist Product Development Engineers in test development, Si debug, and characterization. Perform engineering and correlation studies to ensure yield and reliability meet corporate goals. Participate on cross-functional teams, work closely with R&D team, and help resolve design related issues. Interface with designers and foundry support personnel in support of project milestones. Key Qualifications Semiconductor theory and Electronics Statistics Software/Scripting capability (RTL/Verilog, Pearl/Python) Computer hardware WHAT WOULD SET YOU APART: Advanced technology is a plus! Solid understanding of the basics of transistors and computer architecture. Familiarity with Linux, Ruby/Perl/Python scripting, Java or C++, and regular expressions is preferred. Proficient with Microsoft Office apps What Would Set You Apart Product debug and characterization to determine product performance, process and test sensitivities. Yield analysis and use industry standard tools (Mentor's Tessent Diagnosis, etc) to support yield debug and failure analysis. Develop scripts or tools to create efficiency improvements. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. AMD together we advance_ Job Title: Spring 2023 Signal Integrity Engineering Co-Op/Intern JOB LOCATION: Austin, Texas ONSITE: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. PROGRAM TERM: Spring 2023 (January 9 or January 16, 2023 – May 12, 2023) What You’ll Be Doing Signal Integrity Engineering provides electrical modeling, simulation, and characterization services for the design of high-speed signal propagation and power delivery networks in AMD products. The Signal Integrity Engineering team is also in charge of package and board level design rules for high-speed interconnects and power delivery in all AMD CPU and GPU products. High speed interconnects include interfaces such as GDDR, DDR, USB, PCIE, etc. The Signal Integrity Engineering team is essential to the success of AMD. We develop electrical design rules for high-speed signal paths between IC’s and power delivery paths to IC’s. The team works with package and board level designers to ensure all design rules are met and interfaces can run reliably at targeted speeds across different process, voltage, and temperature (PVT) conditions. We are engaged in new industry technology development as well as in leading edge electrical design analysis (EDA) tool development. What You Will Learn You will have the opportunity to work with the very best in the industry. You will learn how engineering projects are defined and executed. You will learn how engineering teams work together to solve complex technical questions on budget and on schedule. You will learn how to use leading edge commercial electrical engineering EDA tools and more importantly, you will learn how to interpret the data. This position provides an excellent opportunity for the candidate to learn about transmission line theory and other signal integrity fundamentals to pursue a career in system/board level or chip package design. Key Responsibilities You will be generating electrical models and performing Monte Carlo simulations using AMD Electrical Design Analysis (EDA) tool for the design of GDDR memory interface in AMD GPU products. You will work with senior signal integrity engineers to analyze data and work with AMD GPU package designers and GPU board designers to optimize their design. Key Qualifications The ideal candidate should have a solid understanding of electronic circuits and components, as well as understanding how to interpret waveforms captured with an oscilloscope. The candidate should be comfortable with basic scripting (i.e., Python) to automate simulation scripts and to analyze data. Benefits Healthcare coverage, dental and vision Paid holidays Relocation stipend Education assistance for required Co-op/Intern course Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD together we advance_ AMD is looking for a passionate intern to assist our Platform Manager Controller/Configuration (PMC) Systems Design Validation Engineering team in proving and delivering device boot solutions on which customers can rely. The PMC is the primary device gateway/controller that configures and manages the programmable components in the device. The PMC function is at the heart of the next-generation Xilinx products at AMD. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center. Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to look at the opportunities available and to come join our team. AMD is a semiconductor design innovator leading the next era of vivid digital experiences with its ground-breaking Accelerated Processing Units (APUs) which power a wide range of computing devices. AMD’s server computing products are focused on driving industry-leading cloud computing and virtualization environments. AMD’s superior graphics technologies are found in a variety of solutions ranging from game consoles, PCs to supercomputers. If you have a passion for excellence and a drive to achieve, you belong at AMD. Our employees, AMDer’s as we like to call them, work hard, have fun, and thrive on success. We meet the challenges of an evolving marketplace by staying true to our corporate values, including an unwavering respect for individuals and a focus on retaining superior employees. The Yield team is a functional group supporting high quality Graphics, CPU and APU products with the goal to reduce cost of manufacturing, while achieving committed time to market in a predictable and consistent fashion. The Yield Modeling Engineering Co-op is expected to work closely with engineers to generate accurate product yield models for complex product architectures which will be used to drive forward-looking decision making for AMD’s product roadmap. Proficiency in coding/scripting along with strong data analysis skills are important and will be developed in this role. Time will also be spent analyzing product yield signals to drive improvement of forecast model accuracy. Key Responsibilities A Yield Model Engineer develops models to forecast the yield for all of AMD’s products. Detailed model validation work leveraging actual product yield is required to ensure accuracy and opportunity to improve/refine models. A Yield Model Engineer also conducts in-depth investigation and analysis to understand and characterize causes of systematic and random yield loss. The Yield Model Engineering Co-op will work closely with Yield Model Engineers to learn and support this work. Generate yield models for AMD products across all business units leveraging existing model methodology/algorithms. Validate model predictions against silicon data and make improvements to the model where necessary. Work with design teams to model new products in the concept phase. Develop new model algorithms and improve model accuracy. Develop and improve automation to improve overall process efficiency. Forecast product yields over the short and long term. Engineers will be expected to bring a great deal of innovation and creativity to the role. Get a jumpstart on an exciting career – apply today! For more information on AMD visit us at www.amd.com Key Qualifications Data analysis skills are required to be effective in this role. Proficiency in Python highly desired to support and custom algorithms and automate analysis. What Would Set You Apart Knowledge of semiconductor device physics is an asset! Who We’re Looking For A student on track for BS (3rd/4th year) – BSCS or BSEE Or a student BS degree (3rd/4th year) in Math, Physics, or Statistics Attention to details and an ability to learn on the job. Written and verbal communication skills and presentations skills. jobTitle: Spring '23 GPU Modeling Engineer Co-Op/ Intern GPU Modeling
jobDescription: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team. AMD together we advance_ GPU Modeling Engineer JOB LOCATION: Boxborough, MA ONSITE: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. Select One - Program Term This role is for the 2023 Spring term Start Date January 9 or January 16, 2023 – May 12, 2023 What You’ll Be Doing The Architectural Modeling (AM) tool is the single simulator for all graphics products at AMD. The tool is utilized to predict the performance of the next-gen product across different GPU families at AMD. The role of the Engineer/Scientist can be of four different categories. Problem identification: Data from the AM tool is used by AMD architects used to identify points that can be enhanced in our next-gen products. AM team develops a variety of tools and datapoints makes finding performance problems easier. Feature Development: The AM team works with architects on ideas, called features, to improve the graphics architecture. The AM team has the core responsibility of proving or disproving new features inclusion in next-gen products. Model Development: As an AM engineer you will develop the knowledge of the entire graphics and compute pipeline for all our off-the-shelve products, and details of the upcoming changes and their impact. Model Enhancement: AM is a C++ simulator, with python postscripts for data visualization. As an AM engineer you would get the chance to bring your expertise in these languages to improve the AM tools in terms of wall-clock runtime, memory consumption, and complexity. SW Shift Left: Help drive SW shift initiative where we have a model and driver stack to facilitate early architecture analysis and IP verification needs. Key Qualifications Architect, model and analyze hardware and software features to improve products performance, abilities, and cost. The knowledge of the GPU hardware and the efficient use of discrete GPUs, APUs, and mobile devices is a huge plus. The engineer is working with a big team on variety of opportunities, so teamwork and drive are also required. You will drive customer engagement strategy and implementation for CPUs for Wired/Wireless Networking, and Storage market segments. The Person The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills with a strong ability to build relationships within all levels internally and externally. Leading with a strong sense of urgency in driving internal and customer organizations to achieve design win and revenue goals. The candidate will manage a broad range of out-bound product marketing activities, with emphasis on driving revenue, winning customer designs, business development, design win strategy and implementation, sales-tools generation, driving product requirements for key customers, and sales training. The focus of this position will be on AMD processors for Wired and Wireless Networking, Storage and Edge. Key Responsibilities Own and drive segment revenue working closely with the sales team. Define and drive ecosystem in the context of Tier 1 customer engagements. Understand market dynamics and competitive solutions, perform SWOT analysis, and prepare positioning statements. Create a complete set of sales tools, including customer presentations, sales training material that highlight unique value proposition of AMD’s embedded processor product line. Preferred Experience Demonstrated experience in semiconductors/embedded systems/networking/storage with a proven track record of driving customer engagements for processors in networking and storage applications for Service Provider/Enterprise/Cloud market. Strong understanding of Networking technology, trends, usage models, customers and solutions. Strong operational experience with ability to judge, set and drive revenue numbers. Good understanding of Edge market evolution, market segments and technologies. Strong technical background; ability to understand customer requirements and position AMD solutions to win designs. Excellent understanding of CPUs and associated technologies, networking/storage standards and protocols. What You Do At Amd Changes Everything We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. AMD together we advance_ Sr Level- ASIC Verification Engineer The Company AMD's newest acquisition Pensando is a leading provider of data center networking technology. Pensando's distributed services platform will expand AMD's data center product portfolio with a high-performance data processing unit (DPU) and software stack that are already deployed at scale across cloud and enterprise customers including Goldman Sachs, IBM Cloud, Microsoft Azure and Oracle We are hiring ASIC engineers to help contribute to rapidly expanding and innovative chip designs in both 7nm and 5nm process technologies. We are developing cutting-edge domain specific processors for the IAAS and smart-switch markets that leverage the P4 programming language to provide software-defined features and scale but with hard-wired performance attributes. Applications include advanced PCIe, networking, storage, and security virtualization services for both the public and private cloud markets. The Role In this role, you will be responsible for defining test strategies and plans, developing test benches and test cases, and debugging designs helping with micro-architecture. You will participate in design verification methodology definition as well as contribute to design verification infrastructure that facilitates maximum re-use of components, improves productivity, and guarantees to the maximum extent possible, bug-free designs. Your work and skills will be leveraged across module-level, full chip, emulation, prototyping, silicon bring-up, manufacturing diagnostics, compilers, and shipping platform software. Key Responsibilities With your solid knowledge and understanding of Computer Architecture you will be: Developing and executing test plans for Unit/IP/Subsystem/ SOC level verification System Verilog test bench development including stimulus, checkers, transactors/BFMs, assertions and cover points Identifying bugs in architecture, functionality and performance with strong overall debug and analytical skills Languages And Tools PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: UVM, SystemVerilog, C or C++ SystemVerilog simulators and waveform debuggers Experience developing and executing test plans for Unit/IP/Subsystem/ SOC level verification Experience in System Verilog test bench development including stimulus, checkers, transactors/BFMs, assertions and coverpoints Experience identifying bugs in architecture, functionality and performance with strong overall debug and analytical skills Exposure to design and verification tools (VCS or equivalent simulation tools, debug tools like Debussy/DVE) Solid knowledge and understanding of Computer Architecture Excellent debugging and problem-solving skills Academic Credentials BSEE or equivalent. MSEE preferred LOCATION: Milpitas, CA Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. jobTitle: Sr Manager\Principal Engineer, Client business Security
jobDescription: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team. AMD together we advance_ The Role As such, this role will initially need to assess the current state of AMD’s FW, SW and ecosystem capabilities and define the generational improvements required. This will require significant cross functional alignment and teaming skills. Obviously, it also requires an expert level of understanding of the security technologies, capabilities, and challenges. Growth of security development teams to execute is expected to augment the existing program and product management teams within AMD. Leading this effort will require an unusual mix of technical breadth and depth, problem solving, management skills, and soft skills. It’s not for the overly introverted. It is for the ambitious engineering leader who appreciates having a high-visibility role and making a significant impact to both AMD’s client business and the direction of the PC industry. To be successful in this role, you’ll also need to blend excellent technical understanding of the operation of PC systems, highly optimized engineering processes and tools, cross functional and cross company collaboration, mentoring and growing other technical leaders, and translating the business needs of the client product group to the product and system features that meet those requirements. The Person As the leader of the Client Business Security technologies, you will grow and direct a team of talented engineers to deliver world class Security for our business. Partner with internal and external engineering teams, system development, system solutions, and deployment and customer engineering teams to deliver new and innovative security features to AMD product and systems. This is a new, “ground floor” role within AMD client system engineering defined to lead forward looking, leadership capabilities into our products, software, firmware, ecosystem, and ultimately, shipping customer desktop, laptop, and workstation systems. Initial focus areas for this role to lead and grow the required teams, drive to deliver innovation is in security. Key Responsibilities Manage and Lead teams of 30+ engineers to deliver security technology. Lead definition and alignment of SW/FW requirements to implement those improvements Engage existing cross functional efforts and teams working the solution components Define and enter required ecosystem partnership for required solution components Grow required system design and development teams to implement, optimize, tune, and test at the system level Develop strong partnerships with program stakeholders across the organization and development partners Effective with communication and building respect while communicating status to executive level audience Preferred Experience 10+ years of industry experience including at least five years focused on system engineering and Security Depth and expertise in Security technologies Depth and expertise in PC user experience with respect to security Speak firmware and software language Understand PC system level impacts of security functions Ensure system assessments and customer platform attainment to deliver industry best products Academic Credentials Bachelor’s Degree (BS) in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or other relevant discipline Master’s Degree (MS) preferred LOCATION: Austin, TX - Santa Clara, CA - Markham, Canada Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD together we advance_ Sr. Manager Silicon Design Engineering The Role This team is a key gatekeeper for quality of our datacenter HPC products with a specific emphasis on leveraging early bringup, circuit margining and data analysis to validate the full functionality of our HPC products. The team works as an integral part of our design, product engineering, platform and HW teams to ensure we launch products with highest quality standards on time as committed to our customers. They develop and execute system validation test plans to ensure functional correctness and electrical robustness of all xPU features partnering closely with the centralized IP/domain, electrical, and performance validation teams. The validation team must engage from the beginning (to ensure all elements of post-silicon validation readiness and smooth customer solution integration) and stay engaged through post-launch (as our customers continue to expand their offerings based on our products). The Person The leader must collaborate well with cross-company development, manufacturing, and business leads to deliver high quality products at competitive costs and schedule. He/she is the lead server technical leader driving the strategy and execution of validation on our platform solutions to find and solve at-scale functional and electrical issues ahead of product launch. Sound and rapid decision-making skills, ability to handle ambiguity, and consistent visible leadership during customer issues is a must. The leader will be the primary voice of quality from validation organization for the associated full HPC product family. Key Responsibilities Executive level communications on status, problem resolutions, and decisions required is of utmost importance given the fast paced environment. Individual will partner closely with our At Scale Validation capabilities team and IP/Domain Validation execution teams (as well as all other product development and business peers) and must be able to lead engineers as One AMD. A knowledge on server CPU/GPU/APU SoC microarchitecture and system architecture w/ understanding of post- and pre-silicon flows .. will have responsibilities in both. Hands-on work on a variety of different technical items especially related to generating the required stress through concurrent system traffic via off-the-shelf solutions and synthetic hw/sw environments. These technical items will also vary in complexity end success requires growing and empowering a very strong, global, and diverse team of AMD HPC platform engineers. Part of the responsibility is to coordinate with central power/performance and customer teams. The role will involve high level visibility of the most senior leaders inside and outside of the company. We are looking for an experienced Senior Manager and VLSI physical design engineer to join this innovative team. The candidate will be a key contributor and leader for AMD’s next generation cores and caches. The candidate will join the team based in Fort Collins, CO. The Person The candidate should have strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with excellent attention to details. We work on programs with long timelines, so self-motivation and a commitment to meeting deadlines is required. We are pushing the envelope on chip performance, so the status quo must be challenged on every program. This requires creativity and innovation, but also excellent verbal and written communication skills. We work in small teams, but we are part of a large cross-site Core’s organization, so teamwork is also vital our success. Key Responsibilities Manage multiple teams of VLSI design engineers. AMD together we advance_ The Role AMD’s Embedded Business unit is looking for a Senior Customer Program Manager for the exciting role of owning and driving the execution of business-critical customer programs and managing strategic/TIER-1 customers. The Person You will be responsible for enabling customer product launches using AMD products (SoCs, SW) for key customers in the networking business segment. You will drive the execution of customer product launches by working with several internal teams such as silicon design, platform product management, software development, performance benchmarking, and applications engineering. You will build a solid understanding of how different sub-segment customers do their product development and use that knowledge in helping shape the right strategies and good decisions. You will get along with key engineering and management stakeholders of the strategic customers as well as AMD’s field and sales team to report progress, align on critical topics, and drive action items to closure. Key Responsibilities Own and drive enablement execution of strategic networking customer programs, making sure milestones are met on time, action items are tracked and closed, technical issues are resolved, and program risks are mitigated/bypassed in a timely manner. Manage the strategic customers post-design-win through their product launch, to get the best time-to-market and platform entitlement. Report overall execution status internally as well as externally and make critical communication to customers on schedule changes, unforeseen bugs, etc. and align on the right next steps. Craft and deploy standardized lightweight processes to bring execution focus and efficiency. Lead and drive process adoption among other customer program managers. Manage and handle escalations with a sense of urgency and proactive problem solving. Make sure customer issues are assigned, prioritized and response/resolution metrics are met for the customer programs per QoS. Connect and coordinate internally with key stakeholders in cross-functional teams to address and balance prioritization of reasonable needs/asks vs. push-back on others. Connect with customers, as well as AMD executives, to get sponsorship for critical needs of the customer requiring large resource and budget investments. Facilitate closure of complex issues and action items requiring multi-party alignment of AMD teams, customers and their partners. Drive alignment of customer product roadmaps with AMD technology roadmaps and facilitate planning and transition for customers well-established on current technology. Engage directly in hands-on efforts for critical customer issues triage, analysis and resolution. Build strong engineering relationships with the program management and engineering counterparts on the customer side. Help business teams on pre-design-win activities for strategic accounts. Preferred Experience Strong execution skills, excellent customer management and well-versed with different project management tools. Good breadth of technical knowledge (x86, SoC, SW, Tools) and experience in multi-disciplinary areas. Extensive customer program management experience enabling several customers into production (esp. high-volume top-tier customers) while multi-tasking and handling pressure well. Good knowledge of networking market segment and enabling networking customers and their products will be a big plus. Proven track record of enabling several customer product launches especially in the embedded market segments of networking or related. Experience working in a multi-site and multi-cultural environment and ability to travel as needed. Experience in leading a team of customer program managers and creating/deploying processes for efficiency and scale will also be a big plus. Team player with passion and hunger to do whatever it takes for business success. Excellent communication skills. Proficiency in European or Asian languages a plus. Ability to align and build consensus among parties working towards the final goal. Keen sense of urgency and drive for results. Academic Credentials Engineering degree in EE or CS with proven years of proven experience. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. AMD together we advance_ SENIOR CPU CORE ARCHITECTURE/RTL ENGINEER The Role As a Member of Technical Staff CPU Core Architecture/RTL Engineer, you will have an outstanding opportunity to craft a functional unit in AMD’s next-generation core. You will work as part of an experienced, skilled, and motivated engineering team with a track record of success. You will help make AMD’s ambitious future CPU roadmap a reality while working in a highly collaborative environment at the cutting edge of technology. The Person You approach challenges relentlessly with both critical thinking and creativity. You work as part of a team with strong communication and collaboration skills. You have a proven understanding of modern CPU architecture and have ideas and/or drive to make it even better. Does this describe you? If so, then join us! Key Responsibilities Execute on RTL design and coding for various sections of the processor core pipeline and related logic. Collaborate with a team of hardware and software engineers to define the high-level architecture. Participate in the definition of microarchitecture of next-generation high-performance processor cores. Contribute to design verification, synthesis, power reduction, timing convergence, and floorplan efforts Lead teams of designers collaborating on broader features, supervise the work of junior engineers, and drive methodology improvements Preferred Experience Verilog RTL development with industry tools in a CPU, SOC or ASIC environment Demonstrates expertise in the following: Processor Architecture, Logic Design RTL coding experience for a high-speed processor Power-saving techniques Exposure to physical design and verification methods Awareness of synthesis, place and route, and timing closure concepts Development experience from clean-sheet design to product tapeout to post-silicon debug Proven experience with microarchitecture development, as demonstrated by patents, publications, product features Strong problem-solving and debugging skills Background in other aspects of ASIC implementation, especially with synthesis flow and static timing analysis Knowledge of microprocessor Design-for-Test (DFT) and Design-for-Debug (DFD) logic and issues Experience in clocking, reset, power-up sequences and power management Experience with x86 or ARM Architecture (ISA) Comfort with scripting such as Perl, Shell, and Tcl Academic Credentials Bachelor’s, Master’s degree with emphasis in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science with a focus on computer architecture LOCATION: Fishkill, NY Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

AMD together we advance_ The Role AMD AEComputing Methodology team is seeking an experienced engineer with strong background in STA and/ or EMIR analysis engineer to help investigate, develop, and deploy new techniques to optimize and analyze SOC timing, electricals and power. The ideal candidate is comfortable with PNR and custom digital IC design, is familiar with Timing closure and/ or EM/IR concepts. Since this is a Design (not CAD) methodology role, the candidate should be comfortable with Place and route and custom circuit design/ analysis and associated methodologies, tools and flow thereof. As a member of our team, you’d help investigate, develop, and deploy new techniques to optimize and analyze SOCs and 3DICs across various aspects of block, SOC and 3DIC designs, including, but not limited to Timing closure, constraints, Physical design, EMIR analysis and power. This would help us create the next generation of Adaptive and Embedded silicon products including FPGA, APUs, DPUs, AIE and IO subsystems, Monolithic and 3D SOCs to give unparalleled flexibility to AMD customers The Person You are self-motivated energetic engineer who works to optimize/improve the workflow, anticipates technical issues, has deep analytical and problem-solving skills, and enjoys a competitive pace. In addition, you have strong written and verbal skills, excellent presentation skills, strong sense of teamwork, have an exceptional attention to detail and are willing to learn and ready to take on problems. Key Responsibilities Methodology development and new methodology evaluations for Block level and Chip Level timing including, but not limited to constraints, budgeting, timing closure, data handoffs, variation robustness, margins, multi-scenario and timing-exceptions. Methodology development and new methodology evaluations for Block level and Chip Level EMIR, including but not limited to static/ dynamic EMIR drop analysis, Thermal aware EM analysis Evaluate next generation methodologies related to STA, EMIR, 3DIC - SSIT, AoA, CoWoS, etc. Interface with various engineering groups, including Block design, CAD, software, and product engineering to guide design and analysis styles and review verification of blocks Develop/ enhance methodologies Timing / EMIR model generation and verification Debug design and flow issues related to Extraction, Noise, EMIR, timing closure/ modeling/ constraint propgations, etc. Evaluate and establish timing closure requirements for advanced SOC/ 3D-SOC designs and architectures. Evaluate and establish EMIR requirements including but not limited IR drop estimation, power grids and power gate designs, etc. for new products and technologies, and develop methods optimal for given designs. Preferred Experience VLSI Circuit Design and ASIC design flow High Speed logic design and synthesis, Tool driven place and route Timing Analysis and Optimization Electromigration and IR Drop analysis Low Power design Techniques Experience with Physical design and analysis tools such as ICC2, Primetime, Nanotime, Redhawk, Redhawk SC, Totem Experience with tool scripting Perl, Python and TCL are preferred. Academic Credentials Bachelors or Masters degree in computer engineering/Electrical Engineering Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

AMD together we advance_ The Role In this role, you will provide technical expertise for execution on the functional verification strategy for next generation microprocessor designs, maintain and enhance existing functional verification methodology, and improve existing infrastructure. Additionally, you will work on related projects and/or assignments as needed to meet team goals. Examples include project definition, training and documentation, and developing timely and cost effective solutions. You will interface with architects and TG/PG RTL/Designers. The Person We are looking for a candidate with great communication skills and the ability to work independently. If this sounds like you, we welcome you to apply! Key Responsibilities Perform functional feature verification of high speed Microprocessor designs, including development of infrastructure, directed and random test suites at behavioral RTL level across SoC, Core and block hierarchies. Develop environments, infrastructure and test plans to accommodate both full chip and stand alone block level verification and debug capabilities using simulation tools, debug tools and programming skills, based on in-depth understanding of the architecture and HDL/logical design of the microprocessor. Participate in development of formal verification techniques. Develop an automated regression infrastructure setup for functional verification of high speed microprocessor designs. A thorough understanding of design architecture in order to develop, run and debug x86 assembly based directed tests and random exercisers. Validate microprocessor design, leveraging C/C++/Perl/assembly programming, logic design and simulation skill set. Resolve all simulation discrepancies and assertion responses for both behavioral and gate level logic models. Measure and analyze coverage results and take necessary actions to fill in coverage holes. Preferred Experience Demonstrated technical expertise in functional verification of microprocessor designs. Experience with Verilog/System Verilog HDL, programming in Perl, C/C++, and logic simulation. Direct experience with Verilog simulators is a plus. Strong understanding of computer architecture and assembly programming. Academic Credentials BS and 5+ years of experience, MS and 2+ years of experience, or Ph.D with prior experience desired (all degrees are related to CS or EE). LOCATION: Boxborough, MA Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. The selected candidate will be involved in creating and extending features in XRT. AMD together we advance_ The Role AMD is looking for AI/ML experts for growing ML/AI Solutions team, located in San Jose, USA. Successful candidate is going to play a key role to provide seamless end-to-end AI/ML Solutions and working with cutting edge network architectures like NLP (BERT, Transformer), CNN, RNN or any custom network, and mapping them into AMD Next Generation Devices. Candidate will work on system development, performance simulations and optimization, developing SW framework and application. The Person The candidate will work in a highly cross-functional R&D environment, interacting with HW and SW engineering teams, internal acceleration application teams and tier-1&2 customer to enable high performance machine learning networks (NLP/CNN/DNN/RNN). The team is dynamic and fast paced offering each of its members tremendous personal opportunity to grow their knowledge and skills in Machine Learning complex problem solving, product development and system engineering. Key Responsibilities Engaging with software partner architects and engineers to jointly work on performance optimizations, develop benchmarking plans, develop technical collateral (presentations, whitepapers, etc.) to position ML compiler in target market segments, and co-develop joint partner demos and proof-points. The role may also work with partners to create SOW for implementations as needed Interact with Customers, helping them converge on their critical design needs Drive successful Adoption of Xilinx AI Engine tool flows by working closely with key customers, AMD Marketing, Vitis Engineering, and Field Specialists Work with Tech Marketing and Applications Engineering to understand customer needs and accordingly architect new features Work with Architecture team to design next gen ML solutions  Preferred Experience Experience in a field associated with machine learning algorithms and frameworks Expertise with Deep Neural Network architectures like CNN, RNN etc Expertise with AI framework like Pytorch, Tensorflow, Caffe, etc Experience with standard machine learning Models such as RestNet, Transformer, SSD, BERT, DLRM and Reinforcement Learning Knowledge of Acceleration Platform like GPU, TPU, APU, AIE, FPGAs Strong SW programming skills (C++/Python) Strong Analytical skills Excellent written/verbal communication skills Experience in optimizing Machine Learning application for a target architecture is a plus Team player with ability to work across a diverse team, also cross-functionally and in geographically distributed teams.
