AMD together we advance_ The Role We are looking for a dynamic, energetic Senior Systems Software Engineer to join our growing team. As a key contributor to the success of AMD’s product, you will be part of a leading team to drive and improve AMD’s abilities to deliver the highest quality, power optimized, industry leading technologies to market. The Systems Software team fosters and encourages continuous technical innovation to showcase successes as well as facilitate continuous career development. The Person The ideal candidate possesses an innovative and problem-solving mindset, has a keen eye for Software engineering development, and is diligent and passionate about Technology. A successful candidate will need to employ strong knowledge in embedded systems, computer technologies, leadership skills in technical areas, and system software engineering expertise as well as a strong ability to compete effectively in a fast-paced, relevant environment while working with different teams of engineers and collaborators. Key Responsibilities Architecture: Contribute to the architecture and design of the overall platform management solution of Xilinx platforms Software Development: Develop linux user-space & kernel-space apps/drivers for platform management. Develop core firmware that is responsible for power & thermal management. Develop open-source tool to convert system device tree to firmware metadata Quality: Develop software at high-quality with tests, develop firmware following functional safety processes Upstreaming: Any kernel driver work will be upstreamed to linux kernel project Collaboration: Work closely with design team, system architect, fpga design tool (Vivado) team and other teams across timezones to identify & solve problems Ownership: Scope work and risks. Plan milestones & deliver high-quality work artifacts. Transparent in communication to all stakeholders Business focus: Solve issues in platform management solution – pre-bring-up reviews, bring-up & continuous development & maintenance after customer deployment Customer obsession: Responsible for working with internal & external customers and customer support teams for resolving critical customer escalations Preferred Experience Expertise in C programming language Hands-on experience with ARM SoCs and Embedded systems Hands-on experience with bring-up & SoC boot flow Hands-on experience with linux kernel-space, user-space driver & firmware development Hands-on experience collaborating with design engineers Previous experience with Xilinx SoC (Zynq, ZynqMP) and Vivado design tools will be strongly preferred Some experience with python will be preferred Academic Credentials BS or MS in Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or related equivalent LOCATION: San Jose, CA Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD together we advance_ The Role AMD’s Adaptive and Embedded Computing Group (AECG) is seeking Staff Design Verification Engineer, who can provide technical leadership and contribution on Verification of Network-on-Chip (NoC) and high-speed Memory Controller IPs. The individual will help design, develop, and use simulation and/or formal based verification environments, at block and full-chip level, to prove the functional correctness of Network-on-Chip (NoC), System-level Quality of Service (QoS) and DDR, LPDDR, and HBM Memory Controller IP designs. The Person A Senior Member of Technical Staff will be a dynamic, quality-conscious, attention oriented individual with significant experience in successfully verifying products with high quality. Your experience and expertise in developing advance SystemVerilog and UVM based testbench and Automation that can scale with Full-Chip will enable improved execution of AMD’s devices and productivity. Candidate is expected to be a strong team player with good communication and leadership skills and one who is able to positively and strategically influence the Memory Controller design teams with an eye towards improving overall product quality. Key Responsibilities Collaborate with Architecture, Design, and Software teams to prove that the system-level architecture requirements are met as part of Pre-Si Functional Verification. Work includes Test Planning, testbench architecture, execution, tracking, coverage closure, and delivery to programs. Preferred Experience The ideal candidate is one who has a proven track record on driving strategies and successful verification execution of NoC, Crossbar switches, analyzed and verified system-level Performance and QoS requirements. Requires strong understanding of AXI protocol, NoC architecture, DRAM memory controllers, especially DDR4/5, LPDDR4/5, and HBM2/2E/3. Require proven track record in technical leadership of teams with 5+ engineers. This includes planning, execution, tracking, verification closure, and delivery to programs. Requires experience with development of UVM/OVM and/or Verilog, System Verilog test benches and usage of simulation tools/debug environments such as Synopsys VCS, Cadence IES to verify Full-Chip FPGA designs and memory controller IPs. Requires strong understanding of state of the art of verification techniques, including assertion and coverage-driven verification. Experience as a verification architect, establishing the verification methodology, tools and infrastructure for high performance IP and/or VLSI designs is a plus. Requires a familiarity with verification management tools as well as understanding of database management particularly as it pertains to regression management. Experience with FPGA programming and software is a plus. Experience with formal property checking tools such as Cadence (IEV), Jasper and Synopsys (Magellan / VC Formal) is a plus. Experience with gate-level simulation, power-aware verification, reset verification, contention checking is a plus. Experience with silicon debug at the tester and board level is a plus. Academic Credentials Requires BS w/ 5+ yrs or MS w/ 3+ yrs or PhD w/ 1+ yrs in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science. AMD together we advance_ Job Title: Summer 2023 Advanced Packaging Engineering Co-Op/Intern JOB LOCATION: Austin, Texas ONSITE: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. PROGRAM TERM: Summer 2023 (May 15 or May 22, 2023 – August 11, 2023) What You’ll Be Doing As a Co-op/Intern you can get hands-on experience and make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations. You will have unique opportunities to develop your career, connect with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Advanced Packaging is responsible for ensuring AMD has the latest and greatest packaging technology available to support future product introductions. We work with our OSAT and packaging material suppliers to ensure our mutual success. Our team designs and evaluates packaging test vehicles to ready new technology for product design. Typical areas of activity are package design, thermal interface materials, new package platform development, and production support. Advanced Packaging works horizontally to support all AMD product business units. The purpose of this position is to work with an experienced team of packaging development engineers to forward progress in bringing new packaging technology to reality by working with AMD supplier partners. Activities will include project scoping, supplier interaction, experimental data analysis, and communication through the greater AMD Packaging team. Key Responsibilities Assist Product Development Engineers in scoping new development projects. Evaluate and benchmark semiconductor packaging materials (substrates, thermal interface materials, adhesives, epoxy mold compounds, etc.) Work with suppliers and internal team members to analyze experimental reports, apply improvements, and communicate status. Interface with test, failures analysis, design, thermal, and product development engineers to further the project goals. Key Qualifications Familiarity with packaging structure Semiconductor theory What Would Set You Apart Background in Power/Signal integrity Thermal/Mechanical domains Advanced Packaging platforms are a plus! Who We’re Looking For PhD Candidate - Materials Science or Mechanical Engineering background Strong organizational, computer and communication skills Drive to succeed - we expect our team members to engage with a passion! Benefits Healthcare coverage, dental and vision Paid holidays Relocation stipend Education assistance for required Co-op/Intern course Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. PROGRAM TERM: Summer 2023 (May 15 or May 22, 2023 – August 11, 2023) What You’ll Be Doing As a Co-op/Intern you can get hands-on experience and make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations. You will have unique opportunities to develop your career, connect with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Advanced Packaging is responsible for ensuring AMD has the latest and greatest packaging technology available to support future product introductions. We work with our OSAT and packaging material suppliers to ensure our mutual success. Our team designs and evaluates packaging test vehicles to ready new technology for product design. Typical areas of activity are package design, thermal interface materials, new package platform development, and production support. Advanced Packaging works horizontally to support all AMD product business units. The purpose of this position is to work with an experienced team of packaging development engineers to forward progress in bringing new packaging technology to reality by working with AMD supplier partners. Activities will include project scoping, supplier interaction, experimental data analysis, and communication through the greater AMD Packaging team. You will learn to work in a fast-paced global technical team environment. You will see how the work you do can benefit the next generation of advanced Si manufacturing technology. You will become very familiar with the inner workings of AMD and its suppliers. Key Responsibilities Assist Product Development Engineers in scoping new development projects. Evaluate and benchmark semiconductor packaging materials (substrates, thermal interface materials, adhesives, epoxy mold compounds, etc.) Work with suppliers and internal team members to analyze experimental reports, apply improvements, and communicate status. Interface with test, failures analysis, design, thermal, and product development engineers to further the project goals. Key Qualifications Familiarity with packaging structure Semiconductor theory What Would Set You Apart Advanced packaging platforms a plus! Who We’re Looking For Junior/Senior (BS) or (MS) student at an accredited university – Materials Science and Engineering background. Strong organizational, computer and communication skills Drive to succeed, we expect our team members to engage with a passion! AMD together we advance_ Job Title: Summer 2023 Advanced Technology Engineering Co-Op/Intern JOB LOCATION: Austin, Texas ONSITE: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. PROGRAM TERM: Summer 2023 (May 15 or May 22, 2023 – August 11, 2023 ) What You’ll Be Doing As a Co-op/Intern you can get hands-on experience and make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations. You will have unique opportunities to develop your career, connect with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. FTO is responsible for ensuring AMD has the latest and greatest process technology available to support future product introductions. We work with our foundry suppliers to ensure our mutual success. Our team designs and builds test chips into the new technology to ensure it is ready for high volume production. Typical areas of activity are design, testing, quality, reliability, yield analysis and production support. FTO works horizontally across several functional organizations and is a key enabler for ensuring AMD market success on subsequent products. Be prepared, FTO is fast paced and provides opportunities to contribute across multiple disciplines. The purpose of this position is to expedite the validation and ramp on advanced technology. Contributions will span many areas including methodology development, device characterization, statistical analysis, and data interpretation. As a key member of the team, you will have clearly defined deliverables that tie directly to the company's success. You will learn to work in a fast-paced global technical team environment. You will see how the work you do can benefit the next generation of advanced Si manufacturing technology. You will become very familiar with the inner workings of AMD and its suppliers. Assist Product Development Engineers in test development, Si debug, and characterization. Perform engineering and correlation studies to ensure yield and reliability meet corporate goals. Participate on cross-functional teams, work closely with R&D team, and help resolve design related issues. Interface with designers and foundry support personnel in support of project milestones. Key Qualifications Semiconductor theory and Electronics Strong Statistics Software/Scripting capability (Perl/Python) Computer hardware What Would Set You Apart Advanced technology is a plus! SQL queries is a plus! Who We’re Looking For Currently a BS (3rd/4th year) or MS student Strong organizational, computer and communication skills Drive to succeed, we expect our team members to engage with a passion! Benefits Healthcare coverage, dental and vision Paid holidays Relocation stipend Education assistance for required Co-op/Intern course Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. With AMD, you can get the hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge in the workforce. Put that classroom theory into practice and get an inside look at AMD's technical teams, work style and culture. You will enjoy an enriching learning experience during your work term at AMD, with managers, supervisors and colleagues who are all enthusiastic to mentor you. You'll work side-by-side with a team contributing to AMD's success. You will see how the work you do can benefit the next generation of advanced Si manufacturing technology. You will become very familiar with the inner workings of AMD and its suppliers. Assist Product Development Engineers in test development, Si debug, and characterization. Perform engineering and correlation studies to ensure yield and reliability meet corporate goals. Contributions will span many areas including methodology development, technology integration, device characterization, statistical analysis, and data interpretation. You will see how the work you do influences upcoming generations of advanced silicon manufacturing technology. You will have the opportunity to experience life on the inside in an exciting Fortune 500 technology company. Key Responsibilities Assist product engineers in product development, silicon debug and characterization. Perform engineering and correlation studies to ensure yield, device performance and reliability meet corporate goals. Participate in cross-functional teams to resolve design/process issues. Interface with designers and foundry support personnel in support of project milestones. jobTitle: Summer 2023 Circuit Design and Analysis Co-Op/ Intern
jobDescription: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. AMD together we advance_ As a Co-op/Intern you can get hands-on experience and make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations. You will have unique opportunities to develop your career, connect with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Summer 2023 Circuit Design and Analysis Co-op/ Intern LOCATION: Austin, TX USA What Kind Of Role Is This Onsite: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. Program Term Summer: Start Date May 15 or May 22, 2023 – August 11, 2023 What You'll Be Doing In this role, you will join the high-performance core physical design team with a focus on circuit design, clocking, and analysis including silicon debug. You will work directly with external disciplines (CAD/DFT/Architecture, etc.) and will have the opportunity to learn from experienced designers. Design custom CMOS circuits, translating logic description into circuit schematics by conducting feasibility studies to compare possible circuit level implementations of the logic description using the knowledge of various circuit topologies, circuit design styles and Register Transfer Level languages. Perform verification of transistor level circuit to ensure a match to logic description in terms of desired functionality, using knowledge of circuit and logic simulation and debugging skills Optimize circuit behavior to meet performance and local and global power targets, using circuit sizing skills and knowledge of sensitivities of transistor properties to changes in device dimensions. Provide optimized device geometries to mask designers; perform electrical verification of circuit layout to check if circuit Noise, Electro-migration of signal and power routes, IR drop in the power grid and local heating are within prescribed bounds. Suggest circuit modifications such as changing device dimensions, shielding the problematic area, adding new logic, applying knowledge of transistor, interconnect and power grid properties. Characterize circuit to provide timing under different process corners and different operating voltages and temperatures, using skills in circuit simulation tools such as HSpice, for fast analysis when integrating the circuit into a top level block. Analyze critical signals to ensure transmitted across different clock and voltage domains correctly, applying knowledge of Synchronizers and usage of Level shifter circuits. Who We're Looking For The successful candidate is self-motivated and thrives on solving challenging problems. We are seeking someone who is innovative and eager to learn. Does this describe you? If so, then join us! Desirable candidates are working towards an MS degree in Electrical Engineering. Fundamental knowledge of logic, circuit design, CMOS transistor design, and some experience with CAD tools for high-performance design is expected. Benefits Healthcare coverage, dental and vision Paid holidays Relocation stipend Education assistance for required Co-op/Intern course Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. jobTitle: Summer 2023 CPU Core Physical Design Engineer Co-op/Intern
jobDescription: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences - the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team.  AMD together we advance_   Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results.  It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world.   If you have this type of passion, we invite you to look at the opportunities available to come join our team. CPU Core Physical Design Engineer The Role:  This is an opportunity to join the team designing AMD’s award winning “Zen” high-performance processors.   When you join our engineering team, you immediately get involved in our design efforts. You will be joining the team responsible for high-speed logical design and physical implementation of our microprocessor core. Tackling issues such as timing, power optimization, electrical analysis, and design methodology.  The Person:  Are you interested in the following? Taking a design idea and making it into real silicon. Solving novel logic design problems. Learning what goes into a high-end microprocessor. Want to work on the fastest CPU designs in the world? As CPU Cores Physical Design Engineer, you will use front end logic design skills along with traditional physical design skills to achieve the fastest designs CPU designs in cutting edge fabrication technologies   Key Responsibilities: -Logic design  -Custom place-and-route  -Synthesis  -Timing optimization   -Tackle design challenges ranging from synthesis, implementation, static timing analysis, electrical analysis and design closure using EDA tool flows -Preferred Experience: -Solid understanding of Digital Logic Design and Optimization  -Silicon gate-level design  -Timing analysis and optimization  -Electrical reliability analysis -Knowledge of computer architecture  -Scripting languages such as TCL, Perl, Python, or Ruby -Solid understanding of industry EDA tools related to timing analysis, electrical analysis, logic synthesis, place & route  -Understanding of various circuit issues such as signal coupling/noise, IR, electromigration   Education: -Master’s or bachelor’s degree with an emphasis in Electrical or Computer Engineering   Benefits offered are described:  AMD benefits at a glance.   AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.   We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

PROGRAM TERM: Summer 2023 (May 15 or May 22, 2023 – August 11, 2023) What You’ll Be Doing As a Co-op/Intern you can get hands-on experience and make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations. You will have unique opportunities to develop your career, connect with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. In this position, you will perform CPU post-silicon verification and/or manufacturing tests for the next generation of AMD’s flagship CPU products Epyc and Ryzen. The applicant will learn the following: modern AMD X86 CPU architecture, debug tools and methodologies, debug processes, and will gain post-silicon experience. Key Responsibilities Development and implementation of system software to verify CPU architectural and micro-architectural features. Performs CPU functional and manufacturing tests execution via system software and hardware. Develop tools, infrastructure, processes and flows to enable CPU features verification on silicon/emulator functional verification. Debugs test/silicon issues on hardware, emulator. Works on related projects and/or assignments as needed. Key Qualifications Excellent Linux and scripting programming skills (Perl, Python, and/or TCL) Strong programming skills with C/C++ (assembly and developing applications using them) Experience with version control software (e.g. Perforce, Git) Familiarity with computer architecture Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Who We’re Looking For Pursuing BS (3rd/4th year) or MS Degree in Electrical, Computer, or Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent. You are a highly motivated self-starter, who is passionate about CPU architecture, solving problems and reaching goals. You have excellent coding, communication, and interpersonal skills and collaborate well with others on your team, as well as with other business units. Drive to succeed - we expect our team members to engage with a passion! Benefits Healthcare coverage, dental and vision Paid holidays Relocation stipend Education assistance for required Co-op/Intern course Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. Program Term Summer: Start Date May 15 or May 22, 2023 – August 11, 2023 What You'll Be Doing AMD’s Cores Organization delivers industry leading CPU’s and caches that are the foundation of AMD’s server, client, and gaming business. We are looking for a verification co-op/intern engineer to join this innovative team as a technical contributor. They will build their expertise as they help the team deliver cutting-edge designs in a dynamic environment. The candidate will join the team based in Fort Collins, CO. Senior year candidates of BS in EE, CS, CSE (or similar) program. First-year candidate of MS in EE, CS or CSE (or similar) program preferred. We are looking for a college student to join this innovative team. The candidate will be a key contributor for AMD’s next generation cores and caches. The candidate will join the team based in Fort Collins, CO. High speed VLSI design in deep submicron FinFET processes. Work closely with chip architects and designers across multiple sites to optimize power, performance, area, and schedule. Who We're Looking For The candidate should have strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with excellent attention to details. We work on programs with long timelines, so self-motivation and a commitment to meeting deadlines is required. We are pushing the envelope on chip performance, so the status quo must be challenged on every program. This requires creativity and innovation, but also excellent verbal and written communication skills. We work in small teams, but we are part of a large cross-site Core’s organization, so teamwork is also vital our success. Pursing BS/MS in EE, CS, CSE (or similar) What Would Set You Apart Knowledge of basic electrical engineering principles Knowledge of VLSI design concepts & tradeoffs. Familiar with programming languages such as Perl, C, tcl, etc. Basic understanding of computer architecture Knowledge of high-speed flops, synchronizers, level shifters, and SRAM Benefits Healthcare coverage, dental and vision Paid holidays Relocation stipend Education assistance for required Co-op/Intern course Compensation Range & Benefits Compensation expected to from $25 to $37, commensurate with experience and specific skill sets. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team. AMD together we advance_ As a Co-op/Intern you can get hands-on experience and make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations. You will have unique opportunities to develop your career, connect with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Summer 2023 Microprocessor VLSI Physical Design Engineer Co-op/ Intern LOCATION: Fort Collins, Colorado USA What Kind Of Role Is This ONSITE: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. Program Term Summer: Start Date May 15 or May 22, 2023 – August 11, 2023 What You’ll Be Doing AMD’s Cores Organization delivers industry leading CPU’s and caches that are the foundation of AMD’s server, client, and gaming business. We are looking for a college student to join this innovative team. The candidate will be a key contributor for AMD’s next generation cores and caches. The candidate will join the team based in Fort Collins, CO. High speed VLSI design in deep submicron FinFET processes. Work closely with chip architects and designers across multiple sites to optimize power, performance, area, and schedule. Solve design and tool problems requiring ground-breaking approaches and champion innovation across the organization. Create technical presentations for peers and management. Who We’re Looking For The candidate should have strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with excellent attention to details. We work on programs with long timelines, so self-motivation and a commitment to meeting deadlines is required. We are pushing the envelope on chip performance, so the status quo must be challenged on every program. This requires creativity and innovation, but also excellent verbal and written communication skills. We work in small teams, but we are part of a large cross-site Core’s organization, so teamwork is also vital our success. Pursing BS/MS in EE, CS, CSE (or similar) What Would Set You Apart Knowledge of basic electrical engineering principles Knowledge of VLSI design concepts & tradeoffs. Familiar with programming languages such as Perl, C, tcl, etc. Basic understanding of computer architecture Knowledge of high-speed flops, synchronizers, level shifters, and SRAM Benefits Healthcare coverage, dental and vision Paid holidays Relocation stipend Education assistance for required Co-op/Intern course Compensation Range & Benefits Compensation expected to range from $25 to $37, commensurate with experience and specific skill sets. Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

AMD together we advance_ As a Co-op/Intern you can get hands-on experience and make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations. You will have unique opportunities to develop your career, connect with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Summer 2023 Physical Design Co-op/ Intern LOCATION: Austin, TX USA What Kind Of Role Is This Onsite: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. Program Term Summer: Start Date May 15 or May 22, 2023 – August 11, 2023 What You'll Be Doing In this role, you will join the high-performance core physical design team with a focus on circuit design, clocking, and analysis including silicon debug. You will work directly with external disciplines (CAD/DFT/Architecture, etc.) and will have the opportunity to learn from experienced designers. Design custom CMOS circuits, translating logic description into circuit schematics by conducting feasibility studies to compare possible circuit level implementations of the logic description using the knowledge of various circuit topologies, circuit design styles and Register Transfer Level languages. Perform verification of transistor level circuit to ensure a match to logic description in terms of desired functionality, using knowledge of circuit and logic simulation and debugging skills Optimize circuit behavior to meet performance and local and global power targets, using circuit sizing skills and knowledge of sensitivities of transistor properties to changes in device dimensions. Provide optimized device geometries to mask designers; perform electrical verification of circuit layout to check if circuit Noise, Electro-migration of signal and power routes, IR drop in the power grid and local heating are within prescribed bounds. Suggest circuit modifications such as changing device dimensions, shielding the problematic area, adding new logic, applying knowledge of transistor, interconnect and power grid properties. Characterize circuit to provide timing under different process corners and different operating voltages and temperatures, using skills in circuit simulation tools such as HSpice, for fast analysis when integrating the circuit into a top level block. Analyze critical signals to ensure transmitted across different clock and voltage domains correctly, applying knowledge of Synchronizers and usage of Level shifter circuits. Who We're Looking For The successful candidate is self-motivated and thrives on solving challenging problems. We are seeking someone who is innovative and eager to learn. Does this describe you? If so, then join us! Desirable candidates are working towards an MS degree in Electrical Engineering. Fundamental knowledge of logic, circuit design, CMOS transistor design, and some experience with CAD tools for high-performance design is expected. Benefits Healthcare coverage, dental and vision Paid holidays Relocation stipend Education assistance for required Co-op/Intern course Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance. FTO is responsible for ensuring AMD has the latest and greatest process technology available to support future product introductions. We work with our foundry suppliers to ensure our mutual success. Our team designs and builds test chips into the new technology to ensure it is ready for high volume production. Typical areas of activity are design, testing, quality, reliability, yield analysis and production support. FTO works horizontally across several functional organizations and is a key enabler for ensuring AMD market success on subsequent products. Be prepared, FTO is fast paced and provides opportunities to contribute across multiple disciplines. The purpose of this position is to expedite the validation and ramp on advanced technology. Contributions will span many areas including methodology development, device characterization, statistical analysis, and data interpretation. As a key member of the team, you will have clearly defined deliverables that tie directly to the company's success. Key Responsibilities Assist Product Development Engineers in test development, Si debug, and characterization. Perform engineering and correlation studies to ensure yield and reliability meet corporate goals. Participate on cross-functional teams, work closely with R&D team, and help resolve design related issues. Interface with designers and foundry support personnel in support of project milestones. Key Qualifications Semiconductor theory and Electronics Statistics Software/Scripting capability (RTL/Verilog, Pearl/Python) Computer hardware WHAT WOULD SET YOU APART: Advanced technology is a plus! Who We’re Looking For Strong organizational, computer and communication skills Drive to succeed - we expect our team members to engage with a passion! AMD together we advance_ Job Title: Summer 2023 Quality & Reliability Engineering Co-Op/Intern JOB LOCATION: Austin, Texas ONSITE: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. PROGRAM TERM: Summer 2023 (May 15 or May 22, 2023 – August 11, 2023) What You’ll Be Doing As a Co-op/Intern you can get hands-on experience and make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations. You will have unique opportunities to develop your career, connect with AMD leaders, receive one-on-one mentorship, attend amazing networking events, and much more. Quality and Reliability Engineering (Q&R) is responsible for customer quality improvement interfacing on post-design planning and new product qualification. Our team drives customer DPPM (defective parts per million) that can be at ODM (original device manufacturer) or OEM (original equipment manufacturer) and data center. Typical areas of activity are in system level testing, overall quality, reliability, and customer fail log analysis. Q&R engineer works horizontally across several functional organizations (Business unit, engineering leadership, Global Operations organization, business operations, sales and end customers). Q&R is a fast-paced multi-tasking environment. Specialized disciplines within our team include data Analysis, System Level Test (SLT), NPI (new product introduction) flow. The purpose of this position is to contribute significantly to Quality & Reliability teams’ deliverables as part of the overall NPI and quality flow. Contributions may span several areas, with specific emphasis on statistical analysis, semiconductor performance analysis, quality assurance, and data interpretation. As a member of the team, you will have deliverables to support both our near-term deliverables as well as long-term improvement. Key Responsibilities Assist System Q&R Engineers in bring-up system level debug environment, and data analysis of customer fail logs, translating into DPPM, AFR (annual fail rate) and pareto charts. From data analysis perspective, help assess, clean, and validate data quality, Also, help gather, collect, transform datasets over multiple domains and develop dashboards. Participate on cross-functional teams to improve capabilities and/or resolve customer reported DPPM related issues. Write and maintain technical documents to summarize results and progress. Key Qualifications Semiconductor Theory and Electronic Statistics Computer Hardware Coding Who We’re Looking For Currently a BS (3rd/4th year) or MS student Strong organizational, computer, analysis, and communication skills Willingness and interest to work in a hands-on lab environment Drive to succeed, we expect our team members to engage with a passion! Summer 2023 Verification Co-op/ Intern LOCATION: Boxborough, MA USA What Kind Of Role Is This Onsite: This is an onsite position – the intern/co-op is required to relocate if necessary and work full-time (40 hours) from the location office. Program Term Summer: Start Date May 15 or May 22, 2023 – August 11, 2023 What You'll Be Doing Co-op will be involved in learning and execution of the functional verification strategy for next generation microprocessor designs. Maintain and enhance existing functional verification techniques. Improve existing infrastructure. Work on related projects and/or assignments as needed, to meet team goals. Develop quality, timely and cost effective solutions independently as a team member. Interface with local RTL designers and verification teams. Develop an effective working relationship with other parties involved. Perform functional feature verification of high speed Microprocessor designs, including development/support of infrastructure, directed and random test suites at behavioral RTL level. Support and use the existing environments, infrastructure and execute according to test plans to accommodate both full chip and stand alone block level verification and debug capabilities using simulation tools, debug tools and programming skills, based on in-depth understanding of the architecture and HDL/logical design of the microprocessor. Use an automated regression infrastructure setup for functional verification of high speed microprocessor designs. Based on thorough understanding of the design architecture, develop, run and debug x86 assembly based directed tests and random exercisers to validate functionality and testability operation of the microprocessor design leveraging C/C++/Perl/assembly programming, logic design and simulation skill set. Resolve all simulation discrepancies and assertion responses for both behavioral and gate level logic models. Measure and analyze coverage results and take necessary actions to fill in coverage holes. Who We're Looking For Completion of 2nd year of Electrical Engineering or Computer Science program preferred. MS and PhD candidates w/ or w/o prior industry co-op experience are welcome (all degrees are related to CS or EE). Requires strong understanding of computer architecture and assembly programming. Experience with/understanding of Verilog/SystemVerilog HDL, programming in Perl, C/C++, logic simulation is a plus. Key Responsibilities A Yield Model Engineer develops models to forecast the yield for all of AMD’s products. A Yield Model Engineer also conducts in-depth investigation and analysis to understand and characterize causes of systematic and random yield loss. AMD together we advance_ The Role Do you want to be a key contributor in a fast paced and agile environment, and part of a friendly team within AMD developing software for Data Center solutions? The Data Center Video Solutions team is looking for a skilled Windows Driver developer to join our team. As part of our team, you will be responsible for creating Windows based device drivers for our cutting-edge video transcode solutions in the data center. This smart video accelerator solution utilizes industry leading hardware, software and Machine Learning technologies to accelerate numerous types of video workloads for leading Hyperscalers as well as streaming service providers to provide optimal and cost efficient solutions in the Data Center. The drivers you develop will be based on the Windows MCDM driver framework to provide support for the key video processing IP blocks in the underlying hardware and allow a full video processing software stack to be built upon to access the hardware capabilities. The Person The team is looking to welcome a talented, self-driven, motivated, hands-on software engineer who can thrive in a fast-paced agile environment and shares our enthusiasm for developing high performance, easy-to-use, scalable, and extensible tools using modern software development technologies and practices. Key Responsibilities Design and develop Windows MCDM framework based drivers for key IP blocks in our smart video transcode hardware. Some of these drivers will be ported from an existing set of Linux based drivers, hence familiarity with both Windows and Linux device driver support is helpful Provide support for higher level Windows based video software stack to access underlying hardware capabilities. Working with a talented and friendly team of engineers, you will be responsible for the complete life cycle of the solution development, including architecture, design, development, and validation Preferred Experience Strong software development experience in Modern C/C++, and experience using multiple languages and programming paradigms A mindset for developing high quality software stacks with well defined pluggable components using modern build systems and unit testing frameworks Experience with Windows based device driver architecture, design, and code development Experience in working with Windows MCDM based driver frameworks a huge plus Experience with Linux driver development a plus Basic knowledge of Machine Learning architectures a plus Experience with standard video frameworks like FFMPEG, GStreamer etc. a plus A mindset of continuous learning and development Excellent team player with ability to work with teams and individuals spread across geographies. Academic Credentials BS or MS (Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related equivalent) Compensation Range & Benefits Statement Expected to range from $126,700 to $181,000, commensurate with experience and specific skill sets.
